title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Job Description

Due to the current high volume of applicants preference will be given to candidates based in the EU

Company

WEBB Traders is a fast-growing global proprietary trading company and market maker active in electronic trading on international financial markets, driven by data and technology. We are entrepreneurial and innovative - embracing teamwork and creativity. Our headquarters is in Amsterdam City Centre and is supported by a broader European presence from where the regional, US and Brazil markets are traded.

Come and kick-start your IT career at a growing, high-performance trading scale up.

WEBB Traders is looking for graduate software engineers to join our R&D team in Amsterdam, Paris or London. The R&D team is responsible for the evolution of our trading solutions, tools, data processing, workflow automation and connectivity. We are continuously improving our systems and processes, and since we are a small company, we are looking for engineers who are interested in gaining responsibility very quickly and have significant impact on the short- and long-term future of WEBB Traders as a whole.

During the first few years of your career at WEBB Traders, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects, as you rotate through all the different areas of our business. You will learn how to devise and optimise trading algorithms, implement (data) control processes, build crucial infrastructural components and work with big data. We will share with you our secrets to designing and building effective, high quality software and creating a high performance environment with a consistently high rate of innovation and true agility.

You will be:

 * Learning about the trading domain through trainings and on-the-job interactions
 * Developing and optimizing software solutions for trading and all supporting processes, using C++, Python, Rust, SQL and GCP
 * Deeply understanding and improving the numerous processes across the company
 * Collaborating with your team to devise the most effective solutions
 * Interacting with users to understand their objectives and improve their work through your technical ingenuity
   
   

We offer

 * The opportunity to join a highly professional team in a very challenging market
 * Be part of a fast growing and ambitious company
 * Many opportunities to work on your personal development, such as projects, conferences, and study facilities
 * Internal and external training and education in trading software, working agile, hardware and software management
 * A competitive reward package
 * Healthy lunch at the office
 * Free sport facility
 * Travel costs reimbursement
 * Fun activities with colleagues on regular basis
   
   

Requirements

Who are you?

 * Eager, curious and fast learner
 * Bachelor or Master degree in computer science
 * Strong computer science fundamentals
 * Understanding of computer architecture, networking and databases
 * Hands-on experience with modern C++, design patterns & idioms
 * 0 to 2 years experience in a software engineering role
 * Team player who thrives in an agile and fast-paced environment
 * Strong analytical and creative problem solving skills with a ‘get it done’ mentality
   
   

Application process

 * Apply on our WEBB site.
 * Please share with us your motivation to work with us and why you think you will fit.
 * Have a chat via cam with us.
 * Do the programming challenge to show your engineering super powers.
 * Come and visit our office in Amsterdam for interviews and a drink.
 * Accept our offer!
 * _____________________________________________________________________________
   
   

By applying to this vacancy and attaching your resume, you hereby give consent to the processing of your personal data that you have provided, and you declare your agreement with storing these data for a period of 6 months, according to the GDPR law and regulations. After that period, your personal data will be automatically deleted from our databases. All the personal data collected are used by Webbtraders employees, who require access to this data on account of their position, exclusively for recruitment purposes. The employees who are involved in your application process are bound by confidentiality.

If we wish to retain your personal data for a longer period of time, for example for future job opportunities, we will ask again for your consent to retain your data. You can revoke your consent at any time by contacting us and we will immediately delete any personal information.

title: Junior/Medior Frontend Developer
description:
Are you a Frontend Developer who wants to work on building an international fan engagement platform? Would you like to work on a global high-performance platform that delivers the best possible experience to its customers?




Then this is the opportunity for you!




At MatchWornShirt it’s our mission to be the world's leading fan engagement solution. We do this by partnering with the world's biggest sports teams and players. We continuously surprise our clients and customers with innovations and new services driven by our technological expertise.




What you will be part of:




 * You will join us right at the start of the development of our globally distributed network of fan engagement products
 * You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers that work together closely on our new micro-service oriented platform (back-end as well as front-end)
 * We are currently developing a completely new front-end platform that needs to enable our business to grow rapidly
 * You will work on a platform that needs to be highly customizable, flexible and scale well all over the globe. This requires you to apply the latest innovations in the field of front-end technologies




For our technical stack and infrastructure, we look to technologies that scale globally and handle well in the hands of our developers. VueJS (Nuxt), Storyboard, .NET 6, and ElasticSearch. Our infrastructure relies on edge computing, CDN, serverless and Kubernetes for scalability.




Your daily activities will include: writing structured solid code, implementing software patterns, code reviewing, innovating new products and helping our team make the best products.




Requirements




 * You are ambitious and eager to create the best product possible to help us reach for the stars
 * You live in the Netherlands / you have an EU passport
 * Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science or equivalent is an advantage
 * 1+ years of experience with Javascript / CSS / HTML
 * Experience with VueJS/Nuxt is a plus
 * No, not everyone needs to be a football fan




Benefits




 * Opportunity to work in a fast growing international company (600% growth per year for last 3 years)
 * Freedom in decision making and responsibility
 * Working with the newest technologies within web development
 * A great team that is growing rapidly
 * Competitive remuneration, travel expenses, healthy lunch, laptop, 25 vacation days, “Swapfiets” bike in Amsterdam
 * Working with A-level (sport) clients all over the world
 * Opportunity to work from our offices in London or Istanbul from time to time

Our procedure consist our of 4 rounds:




 * Getting to know each other; this will be a first introduction call with our recruiter.
 * Assessment: 2 hours homework via Qualified.
 * Full interview at the office: discuss the results of the assessment with a lead developer a frontend developer
 * Final interview: discuss the final details with our Head of Technology and 2 other team members!




If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, then don’t hesitate to reach out to us.

title: Front-end webdeveloper
description:
Passion, scalability, achievements, safety, and architecture. That’s Egeniq in five words. We are an innovative and pioneering team that is looking for one more important player: you! You may be the front-end web developer who can make our team complete. Someone with extensive experience in working with modern JavaScript frameworks, such as Vue.js, HTML, and CSS. Someone who is always aware of the latest trends and developments.




This is you




 * You keep surprising clients with your skills and drive.
 * For you, self-development is a major goal—that’s a mentality that is partly responsible for our growing client base.
 * Your curiosity regarding the newest features leads you to explore blogs and social media so you’re always up to date on the most sophisticated tools.
 * You share the knowledge that you have gathered on your own blog, website or GitHub account.
 * You are familiar with a techstack like React, Vue.js and TypeScript.
 * Essentially, you are a front-end web developer in heart and soul. “Standard” is not in your vocabulary.
   
   

This is what you’ll do at Egeniq




 * You’ll create amazing responsive apps for mobile, tablet, desktop and TV, and you’ll make a real difference. We work with modern JavaScript frameworks, such as Vue.js.
 * You’ll work in a company that has ambitious objectives. With us, you are at the beginning of something valuable and great, and your input will help shape the future of this company.
 * You’ll get genuine respect for your work. Our management team has a technical background and therefore understands how you perceive your work and the challenges it poses.
 * Join a work environment where you feel perfectly happy, wherever you settle down.
 * Together with our other web developers, you’ll realise the best browser experience in code.
 * You’ll provide input as regards the implementation and technical feasibility of the projects.
 * Your know-how and clear view will enable you to anticipate threats and tackle them directly. But you’ll also recognise opportunities, which you won’t hesitate to grab with both hands!
 * You’ll be working with the Gadget Kit: MacBook Pro, 27” 5k display, and all of the devices you’ll need for the apps that you are going to build.
 * You’ll get items for making your office at home an ideal place to work, such as a standing desk, a good office chair, and a mobile AC unit.




This Is What We Expect From You




 * An extensive knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, such as Vue.js.
 * Modern HTML and CSS fit you like a glove.
 * Transferring UX designs into high-performance responsive web applications is easy for you.
 * Applications with large numbers of concurrent users make you smile.
   
   

This is Egeniq




Egeniq’s approach includes working just as well with the team as with its clients. Innovative projects with a great deal of exposure require this type of collaboration. As our colleague, you can function smoothly in agile development teams, and you fluently speak the same technology language as your co-workers. At Egeniq, we are digital nomads co-operating as a team. Of course, we also see each other now and then. We get together for our Christmas and Summer events, for example, as well as at our meetings at the office once or twice a month.




Does our story appeal to you?




Then please apply via the button on egeniq.recruitee.com and we will get back to your application quickly. We look forward to welcoming you as our new front-end web developer!

title: Software Developer
description:
INTK is an ambitious studio based in Utrecht (25 minutes from Amsterdam). We are specialized in developing digital strategies for cultural organizations.




We work with museums, theaters, film houses, castles, libraries, festivals, etc. Some of the cultural organizations we work with are: Guggenheim Museum, Stadsschouwburg Utrecht, Film Theater Hilversum, Loevestein Castle, Library Utrecht, Le Guess Who festival, etc.




Our mission is to change how people relate to culture. We are inspired by the transformation that happened in the sports sector. Forty years ago, very few people sported. Today, many people dedicate several hours a week to sport. We would like to bring a similar change to the cultural sector. Our goal is to encourage people who love culture to engage in cultural activities on a weekly basis. For example, we want to encourage people that love cinema and rock concerts to go every week to the cinema and once a month to a rock concert.




WHAT DO WE DO?




We work on a combination of three products: ClapApp, CultureToday, and CultureCab.




ClapApp - Personal assistant for your cultural life




Every city needs an app that allows you to see all the cultural activities available. It should work like Deliveroo, Uber eats, etc. You should be able to browse the cultural agenda of your city, buy tickets, and schedule events together with friends.




The app will need to have a database with all the cultural activities. There are two approaches to getting that database. We have an army of people copy/pasting all cultural activities into the database or automating the process.




ClapApp will be your assistant when it comes to your cultural life. It will alert you when there is a new movie from your favorite director or a new concert from your favorite band.




CultureToday - Marketing Digital Assistant




Online marketing is growing bigger and bigger. All cultural organizations could use a marketing assistant. The assistant could automatically create presentations with the marketing results, automatically create campaigns and write monthly reports to be sent by email.




This full-stack project allows you to work with data, APIs, VUE, etc.




CultureCab - CMS for culture




CultureCab is our internal name for an adaptation of a Python/React CMS (Volto) that we use to create websites for cultural organizations.




YOUR JOB




Are you interested in working on a high-impact and short-term project to positively impact thousands of people? Are you passionate about creating software that stretches the limits of technology and beauty? If so, we have the perfect job opportunity for you.




Depending on your expertise and experience, we will together find the right fit and topic which could be Web-development (ReactJS, Angular, Python, Plone, Volto), data analysis (Google Apps Script, Google Sheets, Data Studio), or another topic you want to propose.




OUR CULTURE




We are a young team of international professionals. You will be assigned high responsibility tasks from day one. Every Monday, we analyze the success of the previous week and plan the upcoming. We have lunch together every day. On Fridays, the entire team joins for drinks as we stop working half an hour earlier.




Apply here




https://www.intk.com/en/vacancies/job-positions/software-developer




The Role




You Will Be Responsible For




 * Gathering and evaluating user feedback.
 * Providing code documentation and other inputs to technical documents.
 * Supporting continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and new technologies and presenting these for architectural review.
 * Troubleshooting and debugging to optimise performance.




Ideal Profile




 * You possess a Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field.
 * You have at least 1 year experience, ideally within a Software Engineer role.
 * You are a strong networker & relationship builder
 * You possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical data
 * You are a self-starter and demonstrate a high level of resilience




What's on Offer?




 * Excellent career development opportunities
 * Attractive salary & benefits
 * Opportunity to make a positive impact

title: Junior Java Developer
Full Stack Developer
description:
Here at Fashion Cloud we are transforming the fashion industry and supporting our customers through our solid base of software products. We are looking for a full stack software engineer that can help us grow and maintain our web platform.

Your role

As a full stack engineer, you will be working in cycles of six weeks, crafting and developing the solutions to our customer's problems, in an environment with a high level of autonomy. You will be responsible for developing features and improvements from planning to production.

Our web platform's backend is written in Node.js and we use the Express web framework connected to a MongoDB database. We run on AWS, connecting our services through message queues. Our frontend is written in Angular following our style-guide along with a components library we are still developing. We write all our code in Typescript and ES6.

You'll be part of a cohesive team, pushing for getting the best results and sharing your experiences. You'll be writing highly tested JSON APIs and top notch database queries to support the frontend components you'll be creating, as well as developing our internal libraries and frameworks. We learn from each other, so you'll also do pull request reviews and provide technical mentorship to expand the team's knowledge.

It will be your and your team’s responsibility to ensure we are able to adapt to new circumstances to take every opportunity we have in order to achieve organizational goals. For that, you’ll need to build processes and tooling that will ensure a rapid development cycle that allows experimentation, learning, and changing courses based on the knowledge acquired. All of this needs to happen without compromising quality.

We love writing good software and believe in continuous learning. That means you will get time to expand your knowledge and to build a cool side project. You will be able to attend conferences, play around on different learning platforms and to get whatever you need to help you grow. Plus you'll join our company trips twice a year which are already a legendary tradition.

Your profile

We are looking for experienced full stack engineers passionate in web technologies who feel comfortable designing and writing Javascript code from end to end, from the backend to the frontend.

We are fervent believers in design, so you should be able to design service interfaces and data structures even before coding the endpoint path.

Managers of one thrive at Fashion Cloud. We're eager learners, laugh a lot, we are kind to each other, look up to each other and support each other. We are colleagues, here to grow together.

We value people who can take a stand yet commit even when they disagree. We subject ideas to rigorous consideration and challenge each other with the purpose of growing. That comes with direct feedback and openness to each other's experiences.

We are currently looking for people that would like to relocate to one of our two offices in Amsterdam and Hamburg. We are a highly international team so you will have to speak English fluently.

What we offer

 * Free choice of laptop and equipment (e.g. MacBook)
 * Flexible working times - No 9 to 5, you are in charge of your time!
 * Possibility to work remotely - want to work from another EU country? this is possible for up to 4 weeks a year
 * A great office - we stick to hybrid work model with at least 2 days a week working from the office
 * Summer Camp - a weekend away, full of fun team building activities
 * Summer House - a beautiful location where we work and have fun during summer time
 * Health is wealth - Sports membership discount + mental health support by nilo.health
 * Continuous education - 1000€ yearly development budget, books and online tutorials from Pluralsight
 * Regular team activities - Christmas party, Trivia nights and much more
   
   

About Fashion Cloud

Fashion Cloud is Europe’s leading B2B- platform within the fashion industry. We are here to help connect brands and retailers by proving them with platforms to solve the problems in their daily business.

We are an international team of around 90 people at the moment working in Hamburg and Amsterdam. You'll have all the freedom you need to apply your know-how and help Fashion Cloud continue to grow!

Our web platform's backend is written in Node.js and we use the Express web framework connected to a MongoDB database. We run on AWS, connecting our services through message queues. Our frontend is written in Angular following our style-guide along with a components library we are still developing. We write all our code in Typescript and ES6.

&Work will help you

Fashion Cloud has partnered with &Work. &Work understands that it is important to work in a place where you are valued, where you can develop further and where you are given the space to grow. By applying via &Work, you get direct access to their broad network of employers. &Work can help you with the introduction atFashion Cloud, provide background information, prepare you for interviews so that you can present yourself convincingly and assist you during the negotiations to help you take a nice step forward in your career.

title: Full-Stack Web Developer
description:
Do you want to build products for 50 million kids of all ages?




Poki is an online playground with millions of users around the world. We bring fun games to kids of all ages, while helping game developers achieve success on web and mobile. Our roots are on the web, but we're expanding to bring fun to our users on all platforms. We're looking for an experienced full-stack developer to join our Amsterdam office. Are you interested in an ambitious new digital product that will bring casual games and video to our global multi-million audience? Then read on!




Do you recognize yourself in the following?




 * I’m self-motivated and highly responsible – I thrive on freedom
 * I enjoy working in a dynamic and agile environment
 * I'm always open to new ideas, perspectives and solutions
 * I’m eager to learn, and love to share
 * I'd love to work with a fun, informal and diverse bunch of people




Then we are looking for you!




Your Challenge




 * Create microservices in Go and Node.js. Experiment with other technologies as you see fit.
 * Contribute to the new back and front-end of the Poki Platform, allowing it to grow from 30 million to 100 million monthly active users and beyond.
 * Unify our code base and separate front and backend with low-latency web API’s.
 * Build and continuously deploy features for tens of millions of users around the world.
 * Create SDKs and APIs that will be integrated by hundreds of game developers around the world.
 * Build dashboards for game developers and translate large sets data to actionable insights.




Our Stack




 * Microservices on AWS
 * We just switched from PHP to Go on the back-end
 * React and Redux on the front-end, Node.js for server-side rendering
 * Gitlab for CI, unit tests and deployment
 * Docker for containers
 * Kubernetes for cluster orchestration




You




 * Have 5+ years of professional programming experience, and a lot longer than that as a hobby.
 * Have a deep understanding of modern-day web technologies.
 * Feel comfortable working on the command line.
 * Have hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure technologies, including continuous integration tools such as Gitlab, systems monitoring and alerting with tools such as AWS Cloudwatch and Elasticsearch.
 * Have a solid understanding of design patterns and MVC frameworks.
 * Have a “more effort now to save effort later” mentality.
 * Have a passion for outstanding results, not just clean code.
 * Have a master’s degree or equivalent level of critical thinking.
 * Have excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.
 * Are based in The Netherlands, preferably around Amsterdam.




Bonus Experience




 * Experience with Go and Node.js would be cool, but we believe any good programmer can easily pick up a new language. Your skills, smarts and vision are way more important.
 * Open-source project contributions




TL;DR:




As a Full-Stack Web Developer, you will be joining our experienced development team, and build features and products that bring fun games to tens of millions of users. You'll collaborate with our back-end and front-end developers, and work on various aspects of our code and infrastructure. You'll build microservices in Go and continuously deploy to our high-performance microservice infrastructure on AWS, but you'll also hack away on our React/Redux front-end. You own your microservices, so we're willing let you experiment with other languages from time to time as well.

title: Frontend UI Developer
description:
Ambassadors Lab, the studio for innovation and creative technology within Ambassadors, is looking for a full-time Frontend UI Developer based in our Amsterdam HQ.




Full-time




 * Amsterdam HQ




About The Role




Ambassadors Lab is an international team of technology enthusiasts working on new products and workflows that change how the marketing industry works.




Our key software product – and what you’ll be working on – is




As part of our frontend development team, your key responsibility will be building reusable UI components. Like all developers in the Lab, you’ll be in charge of your own code that’s clean, easily maintainable and of high quality. This means writing, testing and deploying features, and iterating based on QC feedback.




We are a growing, friendly team, so this is an opportunity to have a high impact on the product and collaborate with people from various disciplines. Day-to-day you’ll work with the frontend team lead, the product design team, and the backend team.




Do you have outstanding programming skills and a passion for developing beautiful, innovative applications? Then this role might be for you.




About You




 * You have a bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in a relevant field
 * You’ve got at least one year of experience in a role designing and building web apps or services, ideally at a small or midsize organisation
 * You’re familiar with web development fundamentals and modern techniques, and have a strong drive for high code quality
 * You’re eager to learn, ask questions, give and receive feedback, and develop your skills
 * You’re a proactive problem-solver who cares about users and what they need from our platform
 * You like exploring and leveraging new technology, standards and protocols as they emerge
 * You get excited at the thought of joining a growing product team within an established creative company
 * You’re proud of creating a slick, well-design, and innovative application
 * You’re able to express yourself with full professional proficiency of the English language and can provide clear updates on the progress of development (Dutch is a nice-to-have)
 * You enjoy translating design requirements into human-friendly UI components
 * You have experience working in the creative industry and an understanding of media formats and video processing is a nice-to-have




You Have Experience Working With




 * Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3+ and Javascript
 * Typescript, React, Material UI, JSS
 * Modular/component-based frameworks
 * Translating (Figma) designs to React Elements
 * Proper experience with ES6/ES2015 and beyond
 * Committing your work to a git repo




Follow us on Instagram




About Ambassadors




Ambassadors is a creative production studio with an international team of over 80 artists, composers, designers, directors, and developers who thrive working together to solve today’s creative challenges for brands and agencies. Founded in 2007 and with three studios across Amsterdam and New York, we’re driven by the belief that craft makes all the difference.




About Ambassadors Lab




Working under the umbrella of creative production studio Ambassadors, the Ambassadors Innovation Lab is focused on creating tools and workflows that change how brands, creative agencies and production companies work. Our key project is Cube, a digital asset management and creative automation tool. Developed in 2011 and used by companies including Booking.com and TBWA\NEBOKO, Cube helps teams streamline production workflows to effectively scale creative content. Check out




Working At Ambassadors Lab Means




 * A role in a company that solves business problems for industry-leading brands and agencies
 * 10% of your week can be used to develop new skills and potential side projects
 * The opportunity to learn from a close-knit, inclusive team of tech enthusiasts with innovative mindsets and an international outlook
 * Hybrid working, coming in to the Ambassadors' office in Amsterdam East usually 1-2 days a week to join us for meetings, team lunches, activities, in-person training opportunities and more




If you’re excited about taking on this role, we’d love to hear from you!




Ambassadors is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to supporting diversity and inclusion across race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, or any other category. In doing so, we can help make a positive cultural change in our company and through the creative campaigns we share with the world. Please refrain from adding a photo or your age to your application.

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
We are a young, international, fast-growing organisation with over 110 colleagues in six countries: Belgium, The Netherlands, Poland, United Kingdom, USA and Japan.




We are experts in Human Engagement. We develop and create services that activate target groups, consumers and companies. We connect communication, platform and delivery in a smartly thought-out customer journey. We have grown by organizing group purchases of solar panels and energy for consumers. More than 2.5 million households in Europe have been set in motion by iChoosr and have opted for green electricity, solar panels, remediation of asbestos roofs or increasing their living comfort. We are looking for new concepts in several markets to prepare our company for the future. We have set ambitious goals for this. By 2050, our goal is to have set 50 million people in motion.




What will be your role?




As Full-Stack Developer you literally write the future of iChoosr. At iChoosr the developers are not positioned on the side-line, but they are right in the middle of the business. You actively participate in the search for the best solution for the end user. As you will be the senior developer in the team, you will share your technical knowledge with your colleagues an act as a challenger and sparring partner for them.




 * You are responsible for the front- and backend of the applications related to the group buying projects and other future activities.
 * You work very closely with the Business teams and other Expert teams like Data Analysis, Marketing, Digital Design and New Product Development.
 * You are responsible for the quality of your code and you improve the existing code through refactoring.
 * You know what it is like to work in an agile environment and are able to support your colleagues via coaching.
   




Who are we looking for?




 * You hold a bachelors or masters degree in Computer Science or related area; supplemented with 5-10 years of relevant work experience.
 * You have had a first experience in leading a small team (3-5 developers).
 * You are an excellent communicator; you are social, and you can translate your technical knowledge to the business teams and other stakeholders.
 * You have experience in developing apps for consumers (B2C) and understand the importance of usability, SEO and customer journeys.
 * You have previously worked in an Agile environment. You are flexible enough to adapt to changes that belong to a fast-growing organization.
 * You are innovative and creative: you think out-of-the-box, you can easily see connections and you can translate best practices from other contexts to iChoosrs business and practice.
 * You dare to take risks and feel good in an environment where Fail fast, learn fast is the motto.
 * English is the official language in our organization. Speaking and understanding Dutch, is definitely a plus.
   




What technical skills are we looking for?




We are looking for a Full Stack Developer who is willing to continue to develop. Someone who is multi-employable, with a possible focus on Front-end development.




The following technologies should be part of your knowledge set:




 * .Net Core
 * C#
 * MVC
 * Microservices
 * Javascript
 * Angular (or similar frameworks)
 * Azure
   




What do we offer you?




 * An inspiring and dynamic working environment with fun, smart and motivated colleagues who work together in an informal way.
 * Room for personal development and team development.
 * A nice and fun office in the center of Amsterdam, Antwerp or Warsaw. All our offices are in the city center and easily accessible by public transport.
 * Of course, we also pay you a competitive salary supplemented with 25 holidays
   




Are you enthusiastic about this role?

title: Junior/Medior Backend Developer
description:
Are you a Junior/Medior Backend Developer who wants to work on building an international fan engagement platform? Would you like to work on a global high-performance platform that delivers the best possible experience to its customers?




This could be the opportunity for you!




At MatchWornShirt it’s our mission to be the world's leading fan engagement solution. We do this by partnering with the world's biggest sports teams and players. We continuously surprise our clients and customers with innovations and new services driven by our technological expertise.




What you will be part of:




 * You will join us right at the start of the development of our globally distributed network of fan engagement products
 * You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers that work together closely on our new micro-service oriented platform (back-end as well as front-end)
 * We are currently developing a completely new backend-end platform that needs to enable our business to grow rapidly.
 * You will work on a platform that needs to be highly customizable, flexible and scale well all over the globe. This requires you to apply the latest innovations in the field of backend-end technologies




For our technical stack and infrastructure, we use technologies that scale globally, are open source and enable our team to deliver quality products. Our main technologies are .NET 6, ElasticSearch, NoSQL and VueJS (Nuxt). Our infrastructure relies on edge computing, CDN, serverless and Kubernetes for scalability on AWS. Where necessary we leverage machine learning to help solve business problems.




Your daily activities will include: Writing structured solid code, implementing software patterns, code reviewing, innovating new products and helping our team make the best products.




Requirements




 * You are ambitious and eager to create the best product possible to help us reach for the stars
 * You live in the Netherlands / you have an EU passport
 * Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science or equivalent is an advantage
 * Experience with backend technologies
 * Experience with .NET/C# is a plus
 * No, not everyone needs to be a football fan 😉




Benefits




 * Opportunity to work in a fast growing international company (600% growth per year for last 3 years)
 * Working with the newest technologies within web development
 * Flexibility to work remote - primarily based in Amsterdam
 * A great team that is growing rapidly
 * Competitive remuneration
 * Travel expenses
 * Healthy lunch
 * Macbook or Windows laptop
 * 25 vacation days
 * “Swapfiets” bike in Amsterdam
 * Working with A-level (sport) clients all over the world
 * Opportunity to work from our offices in London or Istanbul from time to time




Our procedure consists out of 4 rounds




 * Getting to know each other; this will be a first introduction call with our recruiter.
 * Assessment: 2 hours homework via Qualified.
 * Full interview at the office: discuss the results of the assessment with a lead developer a backend developer
 * Final interview: discuss the final details with our Head of Technology and 2 other team members!




If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, then don’t hesitate to reach out to us.

title: Software Engineer
description:
You’re a skilled Software Engineer who loves to help our company grow by building enterprise software. You’ll be working with multiple colleagues on many projects to improve our primary processes.




Do you want to be a part of our growth and get a lot of opportunities to grow yourself? Find out more about us here.




Key Responsibilities




As our Software Engineer (32-40 hours), you’ll build the enterprise software that helps our company with its primary processes to a competitive advantage over our competition. We’ve built our own marketing platform, project management system, client portal, and more. You’ll work on a project in a team, depending on the scope of the project. We have daily stand-ups and a scrum session every two weeks, guided by our Scrum Master, where you can present your ideas and work together with the Product Owner to create the best product.




You will be in a Scrum Team. Every morning, you will join the stand up with other developers in the team with a dedicated scrum master and product owner. During the week, you will have refinement, planning, demo and retrospective.




This is part of what made us the leading agency, and an important part of our strategy for the future.




After a week full of exciting projects, Friday has arrived and we are ready for a well-deserved weekend and maybe a few drinks to close off the week.




If you’re curious check our Technology page on our website!




Who are we?




We at Leads.io are a group of tech-driven lead generation specialists spread across nine countries (and counting!). We aspire to help businesses from all over the world to get the best possible ROI through high-quality leads that we generate for them through Facebook, Instagram, display, native, and search channels.




We are result-oriented, and we’re committed to excelling at our craft. We think big, act fast and confidently pave the way for the future. We take our work seriously and push ourselves for the company and our partners, but we have an informal environment and don’t forget to have fun along the way. At Leads.io, you can always be yourself and be the creator of your own success.




Requirements




Are we a perfect match?




 * You enjoy working with multiple systems
 * You’re located in the Netherlands
 * You value clean and maintainable code
 * You score points when you have experience with Typescript and Docker
 * You get energy from working with our own enterprise software
 * You can guide junior developers to improve their craftsmanship




One of Leads.io core values is Thrive as a team and with this in mind, we're dedicated to building teams as diverse as our customers in an inclusive way. Leads.io is looking for the best, most motivated talent and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetic data, or other legally protected status. As research shows that those in traditionally underrepresented people tend to apply only if they check all the boxes. We would still encourage you to apply if you don’t meet every requirement for the role but know ‘you’ve got what it takes’. In addition, should you require accommodations or have any questions at any point during the application or interview process, please let us know.




Benefits




What’s in it for you?




 * 25 holidays per year and 8% holiday pay
 * Hybrid working/ working from home allowance
 * Working in an open culture with plenty of room for personal initiative and growth
 * Knowledge sessions hosted by internal and external experts multiple times a year
 * Daily fresh arranged lunch at the office
 * Flexible working hours
 * Macbook, and mouse/keyboard
 * Possibility to work fully remote at your dream location for up to a month a year




Excited? Wait until you see our cultural values!




💜 Trust – Trusting each other brings the best out of us. Trust helps us build long-term relations.




🤩 Own it – Ownership entails having pride in your work and yourself. We are dedicated to Leads.io and continuously take the initiative to improve our business.




🍀 Grow smart – Our vision is to be the global leader in lead generation. We are committed to continually growing our business while also growing as individuals.




🙌 Thrive as a team – We believe that getting outstanding results is easier and more enjoyable when working together. Together we always strive to become #1.




Does this sound like your new challenge? Apply now, and we’ll be in touch with you soon!

title: Software Engineer Internship
description:
Hey there! 👋

Thanks for your interest in our job opening. We hope this gives you a good impression of what it’s like to work at Deeploy, who we are and what we value. If we spike your interest, don’t hesitate to contact us, we love to have a conversation, no strings attached!

Minimum Qualifications:

 * You have a deep interest in Machine Learning
 * You have a good command of the English
 * You are available full time for at least 5 - 6 months
   
   

Preferred Qualifications:

 * Experience developing and documenting your own project
 * Confidence to help the team and be an all-around team player.
 * Strong desire to learn
   
   

Summary:

 * Our ambition: Be the goto technical foundation for trustworthy AI and enjoy the ride getting there.
 * When the job suits you: We focus on team fit and engineering potential, we want to hire the best interns out of university, giving you the best career opportunities.
 * Technologies we use: Angular, TypeScript, RabbitMQ, Kubernetes, Cypress. If you are unfamiliar with some of these technologies that is ok, there is plenty of room to learn.
   
   

Why? 🤔

Deeploy is a start-up with ambition. We try to solve one of the biggest challenges in AI nowadays: making AI/ML truly accountable.

How? 🚀

We do this by creating state of the art MLOps software for AI developers focussed on giving them the best experience possible.

At Deeploy we like a technical challenge. The beautiful thing is that we are in unexplored territory. So we have to be creative, invest in research and work with our end-users. This way we try to make the best choices possible for our users.

You don’t have to do this on your own. We like to work in dedicated and multidisciplinary teams where all team members can have their own speciality. Ranging from design, QA, architecture and security.

We always strive for quality and perfection, at Deeploy this is a continuous learning process that happens during development. With progressive insights, we adjust goals and approaches when necessary making ourselves and the product better.

This all makes no sense when nobody knows that we are doing all this awesome work. So knowledge sharing is an important part of what we do. As an engineer, this means that you can actively contribute by writing technical blogs, speaking at events, etc.. Next to giving something back to the community, this is also a good opportunity for some personal development.

Most important of all, we love to be part of a team. Sounds a bit cliche, but o so true, as a team we are stronger than individuals, we learn from each other, both on a professional and personal level. Above all working should be fun!

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As an Intern Software Engineer, you'll join our growing Engineering team. You'll work together as a team as well as independently on making our software even better for our clients.

We are looking for an intern that will help us to research and create POCs for new innovative features in our current platform.

We always have a list of research and developments topics for interns with diverse engineering backgrounds. Examples of research questions that come to mind are the following, though we encourage you to introduce your own:

 * Do interactive / conversational explainers improve human feedback?
 * What is a generic way to improve / correct models based on human feedback (by incremental learning)
 * What would be the best architecture improvements to deploy models from a central platform to an edge device? (e.g. Raspberry Pi).
 * What is the most secure way to package Machine Learning models for Edge ML deployments? (e.g., Web Assembly, .wasm)
   
   

Drop us a message for the latest topics

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

 * We like to share and celebrate the small and big milestones that we reach in our common goals.
 * A job when your studies are over for the majority of our interns
   
   

Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let’s have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly with one of the recruitment team, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at jobs@deeploy.ml

How we proceed after the first talk: 📞

Because we think finding and hiring team members is one of the most important things we need to do right as a company, we designed a simple process so you know exactly how we proceed. We like to be quick, and typically complete our interview process within 2 weeks.

 * Step 1: Apply for the job and give us a good impression of yourself. Next to a LinkedIn/CV, we are even more interested in personal projects that you are proud of.
 * Step 2: You’ll have a quick 15-minute introduction call to one of the recruitment team, typically this will be let you know about all the great stuff we’re working on, prepare you for the rounds, and answer any questions you may have. Furthermore, we’ll find out a bit more about you on this call.
 * Step 3: We invite you for another meeting, preferably with 2 team members with who you are likely to work together with in your job. This time we give you a nice coding challenge. Depending on the situation we ask you to prepare the challenge before the meeting. Or even better, we invite you to solve the challenge in our office so you can get a grasp of the Deeploy atmosphere as well. We value your time, so we timebox the challenge to a maximum of 3 hours. Remember, experience is a nice bonus, but we mainly look at your engineering potential and team fit.
 * Step 4: We make an offer and welcome you aboard! 🎉

title: Front end Developer | €78.000 obv 36 hours + bonus
description:
Your job: Front end Developer Amsterdam




 * Would you like to be part of a revolutionary mission that makes an impact on millions of travelers worldwide?
 * How would you like to work on mission-critical systems that are truly the technical heart of this organization?
 * Would you like to completely rebuild this product in parallel in TypeScript & modern JS, within a large-scale microservices/cloud architecture?
 * And what do you think of a 36-hour full-time work week (4x9), hybrid work & where you can always park while you work at the office?

Does this sound like your next challenge? Then read on quickly!




Your employer: builds tangible mission-critical systems for millions of travelers




This very stable company that everyone knows is focused on a revolutionary mission that tries to be at the forefront of the innovation curve when it comes to global travel. Everyone you know has used the tangible systems they build here. They have embarked on a new strategic path for the coming years, namely a smarter and more efficient way to develop the systems. By building a new infrastructure where the organization can deploy much more easily and quickly, they can provide feedback on the systems they build in a very sustainable, secure, and scalable way. So you get immediate feedback on your work on human traffic. How cool is that? People have been proven to stay in their jobs longer because they can solve a wide range of technical problems here, which means an even better learning curve. In addition, work-life balance is one of the most important values within this company. The company has a 36-hour working week, and you can even work 4 x 9! In short, a lot of variety in your work, a lot to learn, and a work-life balance guaranteed at all times.




Your role: Front end Developer Amsterdam




As a Front End Developer Amsterdam, you get the opportunity to work on one of the most mission-critical systems within the entire organization. In fact, if this application does not work, the entire company cannot operate. So you really are one of the key players within the organization! Moreover, they are going to completely rebuild this tangible mission-critical product in the near future alongside the existing product. You get the unique opportunity to build this product completely from scratch! So you can sink your teeth into the microservices architecture, development, deployment in the cloud, improvements, and everything else that is involved in making this product even better than the current one.




Career opportunities




As mentioned before, the teams have little to no rotation, because there is enough challenge, there are unlimited opportunities for growth within different product teams and people can grow in width. As a Senior Front-end Developer, you get the chance to switch internally within different teams and grow to Team Lead, Architect, or even management level.




What is required?




 * Minimum of 3+ years of professional Front end development experience
 * Experience with TypeScript in production!
 * Experience with RxJS, Docker/Kubernetes is a plus
 * Experience with event-driven architectures is a plus
 * You are a team player and have strong communication skills
 * Living & working in Europe




What is offered?




 * Salary up to €78.000 for 36 hours according to added value (+6% fixed bonus)
 * Work 36 hours per week (4x9!!)
 * Flexible working hours
 * Remote working (2 days at the office)
 * Travel allowance
 * Excellent pension
 * Laptop or Macbook
 * Training budget
 * Parking space at the office
 * Relocation package




Would you like a unique opportunity to build one of the most mission-critical systems from scratch as Front end Developer Amsterdam?




Then don't wait any longer and apply via the form below or send your CV & motivation to Melchior Schimmel via m.schimmel@codeguild.nl

title: Junior Java Developer
description:
Zoek jij een junior functie in Hilversum? Waar je volledig intern wordt opgeleid, je snel doorgroeit adhv een eigen ontwikkelplan, je verantwoordelijk bent voor het realiseren van nieuwe functionaliteiten en je zelf invulling mag geven aan je eigen carrièrepad. Dan is deze Java Developer baan bij Prodin een geweldige kans om jouw carrière een instant boost te geven!

Functieomschrijving

Prodin is een Nederlands softwarebedrijf dat is opgericht in 1975. Wij ontwikkelen, implementeren en onderhouden ERP software voor het inrichten en stroomlijnen van operationele, administratieve en financiële processen — waar jij in deze functie een grote rol in gaat spelen.

Als Junior Java Developer krijg je de unieke kans om een intern opleidingstraject te volgen. Je wordt onderdeel van ons Nederlandssprekende development team dat jou ondersteunt in je ontwikkeling. Binnen het team ben je verantwoordelijk voor het realiseren van nieuwe functionaliteiten en het fixen van bugs. Daarnaast werk je aan de ontwikkeling van ons ERP-platform met als belangrijke focus de overgang naar een ‘Software as a Service’-architectuur, waarbij je intensief samenwerkt met de andere software developers, QA officer en productmanager.

Bij Prodin bepaal je zelf in welke richting je jezelf wil specialiseren en stellen we samen met jou een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op. Je kunt je dan focussen op de volgende gebieden;

Application developer;


 * Ontwikkelen van end-user applicaties waarbij je gebruikt maakt van onze Prodin API en libraries
 * Bouwen van applicaties voor Prodin ERP en Prodin Mobile
 * Werken met Java en BBj
   
   

Full Stack Developer;


 * Ontwikkel jezelf verder als application developer plus
 * Ontwikkelen van de Prodin API en libraries
 * Bouwen van interfaces met externe applicaties (REST, SOAP, XML, EDI en meer)
 * Werken met Java, BBj, JavaScript, HTML5 en CSS3
   
   

Software Architect;


 * Ontwikkel jezelf verder als full stack developer plus
 * Opstellen functionele en technische ontwerpen
 * Realiseren en aansturen development team
 * Samenwerken met klanten en Prodin consultants
   
   

Wij vragen

Jij bent helemaal klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je graag verdiepen in onze software. Voor jou is het geen probleem om een langere tijd samen te bouwen aan Prodin en mee te denken met de eindgebruiker. Je communiceert goed met anderen, bent vlot, doortastend en hebt een flink doorzettingsvermogen. Ook neem je mee;


 * Minimaal een hbo-diploma
 * Ervaring met Object Oriented Programming (OOP)
 * Affiniteit met het ontwikkelen van business applicaties in het algemeen (in combinatie met Java is een pre en andere talen als .NET zijn ook mogelijk)
 * Communicatief sterk in Nederlands en Engels (zowel mondeling als schriftelijk)
   
   

Wij bieden

Wanneer je bij Prodin start als Junior Java Developer zijn er genoeg opties om door te groeien naar andere functies binnen het bedrijf. Prodin biedt de unieke mogelijkheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen d.m.v. het persoonlijke opleidingsplan en het interne groeipad. Heb je genoeg ervaring opgedaan? Dan groei je door naar Medior Software Developer. Vervolgens is het mogelijk om verder te groeien naar de functie van Senior Software Developer of naar een leidinggevende rol als bijvoorbeeld Teamlead of Architect.

Als Junior Java Developer kun je rekenen op;


 * Salaris tussen de €2.500 - €3.500 (afhankelijk van jouw ervaring)
 * Pensioenregeling
 * 25 vakantiedagen o.b.v een 40-urige werkweek
 * Opleidingsmogelijkheden met een onbeperkt budget
 * Goede laptop en telefoon van de zaak
 * Reiskostenvergoeding (leaseauto indien nodig)
 * Eén keer per jaar een geweldig feest (je partner mag mee!) en één keer per 2 maanden een personeelsvergadering
   
   

Over Prodin

Prodin Business Solutions (opgericht in 1975) is een Nederlandse leverancier en ontwikkelaar van ERP software. Hiermee helpen wij bedrijven in heel Europa en Noord-Amerika om hun financiële, operationele en administratieve processen sneller en efficiënter te laten verlopen. Wat Prodin kenmerkt is dat wij complexe implementaties en projecten uitvoeren waarbij langdurige partnerships, goede service en stabiliteit centraal staan.

Hoe nu verder?

Ben jij geinteresseerd in bovenstaand profiel voor Junior Java Developer? Prodin ziet graag jouw sollicitatie tegemoet! Door middel van het klikken op de solliciteerbutton kom je in een overzichtelijk sollicitatiescherm waar je met jouw CV kan reageren op de vacature van Junior Java Developer.

title: Front-end Developer
description:
30 Amsterdamse developers kunnen zich niets mooiers voorstellen dan geweldige applicaties maken voor onze klanten en daar zelf veel van opsteken. Je werkt samen met je collega’s bij de klant of als onderdeel van het team van de klant. Waar je ook bent; een vast punt is de ruimte die je krijgt om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Het beste van twee werelden!

Jouw rol

Jij gaat aan de slag als consultant bij één van onze klanten en draagt de verantwoordelijkheid voor het technisch realiseren van (web)applicaties. Je vertaalt de eisen vanuit de business naar technische oplossingen waarbij het leveren van kwaliteit voorop staat. Je komt te werken in een professionele werkomgeving, waarbij je gebruik maakt van Scrum als ontwikkelmethodiek.

Door de ruime mogelijkheden tot het volgen van individuele als collectieve trainingen binnen ilionx ben jij op de hoogte van de laatste trends en opkomende technologieën, frameworks en tools. De Javascript frameworks/libraries zoals Angular, React en Vue kennen voor jou geen geheimen.

Verder heb je;

een afgeronde hbo- of academische opleiding;

minimaal drie jaar relevante werkervaring;

kennis van en ervaring met HTML en CSS (LESS/SASS);

kennis van Javascript frameworks/libraries zoals Angular, React en/of Vue;

een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal op native niveau.

Het team

Het enthousiaste team uit Amsterdam bestaat uit ruim 30 developers die dagelijks gave projecten uitvoeren bij de meest uiteenlopende klanten van ilionx. Je manager Mauk Meewis zorgt voor een prettige werkomgeving waarin hij jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en samenwerken met andere consultants aanmoedigt. Benieuwd naar zijn visie van zijn Unit? Lees het in zijn verhaal!

Tevens stimuleert hij zijn team om nieuwsgierig te blijven en steeds voorop te lopen. Daarom ontmoet het team elkaar regelmatig en delen zij kennis met elkaar. Om persoonlijk te groeien, maar ook gewoon omdat het gezellig is. Zoals de jaarlijkse ilionx DevDays georganiseerd door en voor developers.

Binnen ilionx werken we via het local-voor-local principe, wat inhoudt dat onze focus echt is gericht op projecten en opdrachten in jouw omgeving. Onze opdrachtgevers zijn voornamelijk actief in de financiële sector, overheid, telecom en zakelijke dienstverlening.

Wie we zoeken

 * Dat je resultaat wilt zien bij jouw klanten
 * Dat je een krachtige en enthousiaste gesprekspartner bent
 * Je wilt graag je kennis delen, met collega’s en klanten
 * Je bent op de hoogte van de laatste trends en opkomende technologieën
 * Dat je een leuke, slimme, hardwerkende collega bent
   
   

Wat we bieden

 * Interessante klanten en boeiende projecten
 * Werken met de nieuwste technologieën, frameworks en tools
 * Gave opdrachten en uitdagende puzzels
 * Als eerste op de hoogte van ontwikkelingen in de markt dankzij onze nauwe contacten met onze technology partners
 * Veel gelegenheid om met collega’s kennis en ervaringen te delen
   
   

Over ilionx

Zoek jij een uitdagende baan bij een bedrijf met een open en informele sfeer? Dan ben je bij ilionx aan het juiste adres! ilionx is een middelgrote IT-dienstverlener die klanten in staat stelt om voorop te lopen met digitale transformatie. Vanuit verschillende locaties ondersteunen ze deze klanten op het gebied van data science, business intelligence en meer!

&Work helpt je verder

ilionx werkt samen met &Work. &Work begrijpt dat het belangrijk is om te werken op een plek waar je gewaardeerd wordt, waar je je verder kunt ontwikkelen en waar je de ruimte krijgt om te groeien. Door via &Work te solliciteren, krijg je direct toegang tot hun brede netwerk van werkgevers. &Work kan je helpen bij de introductie bij ilionx, achtergrondinformatie verstrekken, je voorbereiden op gesprekken zodat je jezelf overtuigend kan presenteren en je bijstaan tijdens de onderhandelingen om je een mooie stap vooruit te laten zetten in je carrière.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Welcome to SkillLab




At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.




Your opportunity




 * You will be working on developing the server-side infrastructure that allows our innovative and AI-driven web application to be used by millions of (marginalized) job seekers across the globe
 * Say goodbye to various approval loops to make smaller architecture changes. You will be working in an agile product development team and immediately see the result of your engineering work
 * You will experience the culture of a technology start-up and work in an international environment with SkillLabers from +20 countries




Your team




You will join our product team as the new back-end software engineer:




 * Ragnar is one of SkillLab co-founders and leads the Product team.
 * Aaron is our Backend Lead. You will work closely with him and directly report to him.
 * Our backend software engineers are Barry, Lala, Alrefai, Yasser, Vlad.
 * Our frontend engineers are Ibraheem, Ivana, Kilani, and Mojtaba.
 * Gaspar is our full-stack engineer, Luiza our QA engineer and Hamza works in DevOps.
 * Our product managers are Hadeel, Hayani & Omar.
 * You will work and interact with many more fantastic team members from Data Science and UX/UI.




We are proud of the people we collaborate with and proud to work at a company with a strong social mission. We hope you will be too!




What you will do




 * You will develop the robust, secure and scalable server-side infrastructure of our progressive web application, built primarily in Ruby on Rails as an API server with a React client and deployed in containers on Kubernetes in GCP and elsewhere
 * You will collaborate with the entire product team through a collaborative product design process, code review, data engineering and operational support
 * You will own some features as Tech Lead and support your teammates on the codebase as a whole
 * You will learn how we leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence to allow job seekers to better understand their skills and get matched to education and jobs




Requirements




Is this you?




 * You have 4-8 years of experience as a web application backend developer
 * You have experience with Ruby on Rails, Postgres, Redis, Docker, Kubernetes and adjacent tech
 * You are able to take a feature from business requirements to secure, performant implementation in collaboration with a small team
 * You have a learning mindset and bring the drive and curiosity to new tackle new coding challenges
 * You work collaboratively in an engineering team and are empathic towards our end-users
 * You are excited about our social mission to empower everyone to have a pathway to employment




Extra awesome




 * You have some experience of with AWS and some front-end development work




Salary, start-date & location




 * We use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 57k-85k Euro per year.
 * We strongly prefer on-site candidates who live in Amsterdam or will relocate to Amsterdam from different countries. However, we are open to remote applicants who will make intermittent trips to Amsterdam from cities within the Netherlands
 * We accept applications on a rolling basis, and we envision a start date as soon as possible




Benefits




 * You will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year.
 * You can work flexibly both from our office in Amsterdam or remotely within the Netherlands. You can also extend your holiday stay in a different country and work from abroad for a limited period of time
 * You will get an extensive relocation support to move to Amsterdam including visa sponsorship, 30% ruling application, your plane tickets, first 2-weeks of hotel accommodation etc
 * You can easily access your learning budget to invest in your personal development
 * You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)
 * You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores
 * You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etc




What Else To Know




 * SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds
 * This is our tech stack and how we build technology with impact (Building technology with impact - SkillLab)
 * Get 3 tips for your job application at SkillLab (Three Tips for your Job Application - SkillLab)
 * If this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Summary




Just imagine: starting work every morning with a wide smile, with a curious and inclusive bunch of 22 engineers. You are helping to build a solid backend and add cool features. You are hands-on coding in PHP, familiar with Laravel, used to working with databases (MySQL, ElasticSearch and Redis) and external API's. Imagine, as well, having all of your hard work see the light of day and have impact: all the features we work on are getting deployed to production in an instant and shipped to around 38,000 users.




At Trengo, we believe in a world where technology empowers the relationship between companies and their customers. That’s why our mission is to build the smartest customer engagement platform to replace repetitive work with meaningful conversations. How do we do that? Our software makes it easy for customer-facing teams to communicate with customers via multiple channels, all in one shared inbox. Email, Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, live-chat, you name it. With a Series A investment of $36M led by Insight Partners and Peak Capital and becoming one of the four official WhatsApp Business Solutions Providers in the Netherlands, we empower our customers to scale their businesses and optimize the channels their clients truly prefer.




Have a look at our documentation for different Trengo integrations, like the website widget, REST APIs, sidebar apps, custom channels and Flowbots: https://developers.trengo.com/ . You are also welcome to create a free trial account and have a peek at Trengo.




What Your Day Looks Like




Let's break down this big vision into a little taste of your work at Trengo:




 * It might be refreshing for you to know that building new features in Laravel is what takes most, if not all of our time. And we don't plan to stop innovating any time soon. We are fast to send features to production and ship them- this is always after peer review. We collaborate a lot. We are all for the team spirit. You can see that in our jokes and memes too, but that's another story :-).
 * We like to think of these features as MVP's: design them, build them including unit tests, ship them and then see what value they add to the market. It is rewarding to read the feedback from the customers who beta test them and to share our wins with the whole team.




FYI, our frontend code is written in Javascript with Vue.js . There’s no harm if you like a bit of that as well!




What We Expect From You




Now that you know a bit about us, can you tell me a bit about you? I hope you can identify with some of these:




 * You've seen some stuff: you have been in the middle of the action when a digital/tech-focused company scaled up.
 * You are used to work with external APIs. We mostly integrate messaging API's, E-commerce and CRM software.
 * You’re not only using external APIs, so will shape the Trengo APIs as well.
 * You enjoy coding in PHP, within the Laravel framework. If you are already familiar with it, then we have no major surprises for you, because we follow the Laravel best practices.
 * You write your own tests, you are used to TDD, both unit and integration tests.
 * You are able to work independently and stand behind your own decisions (not in a hierarchical way, but rather in a critical/constructive way).
 * You are just as helpful and collaborative as us. We have a good thing going on in our tech team and would like a kind person to join us.




What We Offer




This is what we carefully prepared for you:




 * Finding yourself in a fast-growing company where your career can evolve. With the help of your number one supporter, your manager, you will follow our departmental growth tracks to pursue the career you want. This is one of the reasons for our positive Glassdoor reviews (4.3/5).
 * We really value flexibility and trust our people. That’s why we work hybrid, and our people can work from abroad for 60 days per year.
 * Free sessions with on-demand psychologists from OpenUp . Your mental health is important to us.
 * An education budget of €1000 to feed your curiosity, extra budget for team trainings, and 2 extra days off for your courses or conferences, if needed.
 * 28 vacation days to rest, have fun, and travel as you wish. But, every once in a while, we also like to do it together. The last time, we went on an amazing trip to Valencia !
 * Weekly Yoga and Bootcamp classes in our office to blow some steam off after work with the guidance from a certified trainer!
 * Fancy learning Dutch? We also offer Dutch courses for our international employees!
 * When you work from our beautiful office : you can bet we have delicious warm lunches together prepared by our in-house chef and workplace experience team. Also, your traveling expenses to Utrecht will be reimbursed.




Your Recruitment Experience At Trengo




We aim for our recruitment experience to be fast, enjoyable, and fruitful - for both sides. Via this link , you can see what you can expect from your recruitment journey with us.




Otherwise don’t worry, we understand if you don’t know what to do right now. You like what you read but you still have questions before deciding to move forward. We got you! I am Evangelos , your friendly recruiter and part of Trengo’s Talent Team. Happy to clarify any doubts, so you can make a good choice, whichever that is. If you are not ready to apply yet, feel free to ask a question in the Flowbot. If you are ready, talk to you soon.

title: Web Developer
Full Stack Developer
description:
Over de rol

In een wereld vol informatie is heldere informatie koning. Met information design maken we complexe materie op een visuele manier begrijpelijk. Hier kan jij als developer aan bijdragen door samen met het team de ontwerpen van de designers tot leven te laten komen en creaties voor onze klanten te creëren. Je denkt actief mee over werkbare concepten, gebruiksvriendelijkheid en geeft vanaf de conceptfase input op wat wel en niet werkt voor interactieve producties. Ook ben jij verantwoordelijk voor de werking en onderhoud van de websites. Dat je dit nog niet helemaal tot in de puntjes beheerst vinden wij alleen maar leuk, wij nemen je namelijk graag mee in de wereld van design, informatie en development.

Wat betekent dit concreet

 * Jij gaat werken aan producten zoals: dashboards & tools, microsites & scrollstories, interactieve datavisualisaties & interactieve merkervaringen.
 * Samen met onze creatieven bedenk jij originele, creatieve en interactieve oplossingen voor onze klanten. Denk hierbij aan het tot leven brengen van micro-animaties tot aan het creëren van websites waarvoor jij samen met je collega’s de interactie van het UX/UI design verzorgt.
 * Jij hebt de verantwoordelijkheid voor het uitwerken van ontwerpen tot een werkende productie, veelal op basis van web-technologieën.
 * Jij draagt zorg voor de werking en het onderhoud van onze websites. Je houdt o.a. de server veilig, zorgt dat de code pakketten up to date zijn en de website goed draait om zo te zorgen dat de klant haar website tot het maximale kan benutten.
 * Jij brengt de functionele en technische randvoorwaarden voor creatieve producties in kaart en adviseert de teams hierover.
 * Jouw enthousiasme voor nieuwe technologieën zet jij je in voor het bedenken van nieuwe features en werkt deze uit voor onze websites. Hierdoor zorg je dat de performance van deze websites continu verbetert.
   

Wat breng jij mee?

 * Enthousiasme om te werken aan verschillende projecten voor steeds wisselende klanten, maar wel altijd met een team van Clarify’ers die allemaal een andere discipline beheersen. Een steile leercurve is gegarandeerd!
 * Je kan HTML, CSS en JavaScript dromen (of we helpen je daar te komen)
 * Je wordt er blij van om UX/UI designs tot leven te wekken. Je krijgt er energie van om met behulp van subtiele animaties de UI nóg soepeler te laten werken, of voor nét dat beetje extra verwondering te zorgen.
 * Je hebt ervaring met Git en weet hoe je je code modulair organiseert in incheckt in de repository.
 * Je hebt ervaring met React en Next.js voor websites gebaseerd op een headless CMS.
 * Je kan ook je weg vinden in klassieke Wordpress Sites die met PHP en MySQL zijn gebouwd.
 * Naast het zijn van een (to be) goede coder, ben je analytisch sterk en snap jij de (on)mogelijkheden van techniek. Je kan hier al best een mening over vormen en vindt het dan ook leuk om mee te denken over de inhoud en gebruiksvriendelijkheid van producties.
 * Dit wordt niet jouw eerste keer richting een kantoor en je hebt daarom in ieder geval één tot drie jaar officiële werkervaring. Officieus vinden wij het natuurlijk helemaal top als jij in de afgelopen jaren al eens een website in elkaar hebt geknutseld of gewoon alles digital wil begrijpen.
 * Jouw hoogste doel is uiteraard dat onze klanten blij zijn, daarom mis je geen deadline en ben je zelfs liever iets eerder klaar met je opdracht. Onze klanten zijn je eeuwig dankbaar.
 * We werken veel voor Nederlandse klanten, dus als je de Nederlandse taal beheerst is dat fijn maar geen vereiste. Spreek je alleen Engels, dan is dat ook helemaal goed
   

Wat kan je van ons verwachten?

 * Een goed salaris op basis van relevante ervaring en eigentijdse secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden (waaronder 26 vrije dagen, pensioenopbouw en een jaarlijkse bureaureis).
 * De vrijheid om je rol in te vullen op de manier die het beste bij jou en je interesses past. Als je maar op vrijdagmiddag mee doet met een potje tafeltennis
 * Een dynamische omgeving, met aandacht voor persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling.
 * Een kantoor met informele sfeer op een mooie locatie in de Houthavens van Amsterdam.
   

Over Clarify

Bij Clarify geloven we dat duidelijkheid je verder brengt. Wij maken complexe materie van onze klanten begrijpelijk. We werken op het snijvlak van design, consultancy en techniek. Met infographics, explanimations, interactieve tools en visual consultancy. Information design noemen we dat.

Complexiteit is overal. We werken dan ook voor veel verschillende opdrachtgevers – van start-ups tot de overheid en alles wat daartussen zit. Dit doen we al sinds 2003 met Booreiland, in60seconds en Getting the picture. Vanaf 2022 zijn we samen Clarify en hebben we een duidelijke missie: complexe informatie vertalen naar kraakheldere verhalen.

Solliciteer

Wil jij ons team komen versterken? Solliciteer dan nu met jouw CV en motivatie via onderstaande button. Heb je nog vragen over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met vacature@clarify.nl (dit e-mailadres is niet om te solliciteren).

title: Full Stack Developer C#
description:
Full Stack Developer, .NET C#, Windows applications, International and Multicultural, Amsterdam, Fixed office location, Permanent employment, Great secondary employment benefits
