title: Junior Java Developer
Full stack Java developer
description:
Full stack developer




The opportunity




We are looking for a strong, experienced developer that wants to join a small, focused team. Each developer is capable of working in the frontend as well as the backend of the application.




The team




Within Team 42, we take care of Direct Debits. If you are subscribed to Netflix or Spotify and money is automatically taken off your account, you’re probably using us! We are taking care of three full stack applications, that help both consumers as well as companies and we receive millions of transactions a month.




At Team 42, we hold each other accountable for our work. We use a light but efficient process to get things done. We believe in good code and try to become better every day. For this reason, we are now using Kotlin, use lit-html and refactor code where we could keep using the Java and WebComponents stack.




Roles And Responsibilities




As an engineer in our 5 people squad (+ product owner), you are responsible for maintaining and implementing the roadmap of all the applications and tools used to support direct debits. That means maintaining our tech stack, but also implement new features, in order to serve our customers.




 * Most of our code is built using Java 8 (functional style) and Java 11, but we are also writing in Kotlin.
 * The front-end is written in Web Components (Polymer and lit-html) and ES6. Some of our old frontend is still written in Angular 1.7 though.
 * Cucumber and Gatling for integration and acceptance tests
 * ELK stack and Prometheus for monitoring
 * We use AzureDevOps as our CI/CD solution




How To Succeed




We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.




 * Experience with backend (Java8, 11 and Kotlin)
 * Some exposure to JavaScript, Webcomponents, LitHTML would be useful
 * Experience in continuous testing environments
 * Strong analytical skills
 * Team player – must have!
 * Willing to improve, every day
 * English speaking and writing skills – must have!
 * Experience with the ING environment would be very handy




Rewards & Benefits




Rewards and benefits




We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm




The Benefits Of Working With Us At ING Include




 * A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
 * 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
 * Pension scheme
 * 13th month salary
 * Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
 * 8% Holiday payment
 * Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
 * An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
 * Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster




About Us




With 57,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
description:
About Gameye




We’re Gameye. We’re on a mission to host the world’s most demanding games flawlessly. So we’ve created an orchestrator that lets multiplayer developers host their game sessions automatically.




Now, we need a software engineer to help us evolve, improve, and refine our platform. Someone who knows their way around code, while also coming up with ideas for the future.




Requirements




Who you are




Our ideal recruit is someone who lives and breathes programming, but also knows how to put the end result to the test. An expert who knows the best practices and has the communication skills to explain them to the rest of us. Someone who isn’t afraid to raise concerns and speak their mind.




While experience in the gaming sector is a bonus, it’s not essential. It’s far more important that you’re a relaxed person, not a corporate robot. You’ll also be pretty good at managing your own time: choosing how your own day looks, setting your own deadlines, and keeping to them.




What will you be doing?




 * Coding and testing
 * Creating our testing processes and writing documentation
 * Figuring out how testing fits into our flow
 * Working on our orchestrator’s micro services
 * Testing automation, integration and units
 * Answering tickets and working on features
 * Tinkering with our infrastructure
 * Dabbling in DevOps
 * Contributing to meetings: Discussing and helping us make a better product and deciding the roadmap together




What Will Make You Stand Out




 * You’ve been coding and testing for about four or five years or more
 * You’ve got mostly professional experience, plus any experience through hobby work
 * You know the difference between a micro-service and a monolith
 * You know the difference between white box and black box testing
 * You know Docker inside out and dream of Kubernetes
 * You’re very familiar with GitOps
 * You know TypeScript and NodeJS. Statically typed languages like Rust, Go, and C/C++ are a bonus
 * You’re self-driven, motivated and proactive – someone who’ll work toward a target, not just tick off boxes




Bear in mind, we won’t rule you out just because you’re missing one or two things from the list. Although, the more you have, the better you’re likely to fit.




Benefits




 * Work wherever you like: We’re 100% remote. While our company was established in the Netherlands, we have no physical HQ. Your office is wherever you choose it to be
 * Pick your work hours: We’d love to see you during our core hours (9am to 5pm Amsterdam time) and you’ll need to come to our daily meetings. But, apart from those, you can fit your work around your life (not the other way around)
 * We’ll sort your station: Keyboard worse for wear? No problem. Put in a request, and we’ll get you a brand-new one. We’ll make sure you have the tools you need
 * Coffee is on us: Staying cooped up indoors isn’t healthy. So we’ll give you a daily budget to go out each day




One of our core values is that we’re completely agnostic. So we want to work with the best people, regardless of your background. If that sounds like you, we want to see your resume.

title: Python/django Back-end Developer
description:
We're on the lookout for a new skilled Back-End Python/Django Developer to join the NextGear team. We are growing incredibly fast and are in need for some extra hands to keep up the momentum. That's where you come in!

Your role

In short; we're looking for a backender who can help us improve our platform. After an intense period, where the main goal was to launch as quickly as possible, we are now keen on improving the platform. This applies as much to the UI as it does for anything behind the scenes. We always have to keep an eye on security and reliability due to the amount of money that is processed via the platform, while also keeping an eye on usability and performance, since we receive up to 10k backend requests per minute, a number that keeps going up.

Give me some details…

At the moment our focus is on gradually replacing a frontend written in Django by a React-based frontend. This is why the last people to join us in 2022 were both frontenders.

The new frontend will allow us to scale up further. It connects to an API that we are adding to the existing Django project, after which we’ll remove the existing frontend code from the Django project. Meanwhile, we’re writing new functionality in plain Django, which may be moved to React later on. The rewrite also offers us the opportunity to reflect on, and improve, on the current design and usability.

Your activities will consist of;

 * Working on new features for existing project components
 * Being responsible for native Django views (model/view/template) and/or admin
 * REST framework endpoints
 * Interfacing with existing APIs for payment providers and other 3rd parties
 * Writing (new) microservices (plain Python or Flask)
 * Doing data science stuff
 * Reviewing merge requests
 * Refactoring and writings tests
 * CI config
 * …honestly there’s a lot we want to do, we’re full of plans and ideas
   
   

Your profile

Ideally you’d have a skillset like this:

 * Experience with Python/Django (we try to follow PEP8)
 * Knowledge of common design patterns
 * This would make you stand out: you have experience with projects running on AWS (e.g. S3 implementation or Rekognition usage)
   
   

What we really need:

 * An experienced programmer
 * Being able to think outside the box of your own tasks
   
   

Don’t fuss about:

 * Not knowing Django when you have experience with Python
 * Only feeling fit for some of the activities we mention
   
   

What we offer

 * Competitive salary, paid holidays, benefits package and 13th month
 * Collaborative and friendly work environment
 * Hybrid working with at least one day at the office
 * Possible travel expenses will be compensated
 * Flexible work schedule
 * Free lunch and drinks at the office
 * Work trips (upcoming one is to Bucharest with the entire team)
   
   

About NextGear

NextGear was founded back in 2003. For more than 20 years, NextGear has been building impactful digital solutions for versatile clients from different industries, ranging from the Aviation industry to Finance and Social Communities. We're proud to have a team of highly motivated and young tech enthusiasts between 20 and 40 who work on everything from design and front end to backend and infrastructure. We have a healthy mix of external clients and in-house project. Our exciting new platform, launched last year, has exceeded all our expectations, and now we need to grow our team to help us take it to the next level.

Where?

We're a hybrid-remote team that values flexibility. Our goal is to see each other at least once a week, because we feel that helps to stay in tune. Other than that, you can work from home or from our office located in the heart of Amsterdam. We're a diverse group of people who love to work hard and play even harder. We offer a Dutch lunch - or Surinamese food on the first Monday of every month, and we have an excellent espresso machine for coffee lovers (but don't worry, we have tea too). We're also a safe, open, and transparent community, and we have the occasional furry friend in the office.

&Work will help you

NextGear has partnered with &Work. &Work understands that it is important to work in a place where you are valued, where you can develop further and where you are given the space to grow. By applying via &Work, you get direct access to their broad network of employers. &Work can help you with the introduction atNextGear, provide background information, prepare you for interviews so that you can present yourself convincingly and assist you during the negotiations to help you take a nice step forward in your career.

title: Full Stack Developer C#
description:
Full Stack Developer, .NET C#, Windows applications, International and Multicultural, Amsterdam, Fixed office location, Permanent employment, Great secondary employment benefits, salary +- 70k per year




Since approximately 1985, our respected client with offices in the areas of Amsterdam, Eindhoven, and ’s-Hertogenbosch has been developing innovative powerline and data communications products. They use it to connect not only the networked world in businesses and in the smart grid, but above all people. Their goal is to make the complex world of data communication more simple. Hence they are developing future-oriented products and solutions together with their famous partners.




Our client is like no other manufacturer when it comes to intelligent networking products. Computers, mobile devices, electronics and smart technologies are growing together into a strong network. Our client expands on the idea of the easy way to connect and is emerging as a new product in the world for the smart environment that simply enables greater comfort, convenience, security and energy savings.




Together with their products for end customers and large industrial businesses, our client has established three business areas for commercial users and industrial products. While their business like solutions ensures perfect connections in commercial applications, the operator solutions company area outfits telecommunications providers and Internet service providers. Additionally, the power industry is a driving force with its demand for an innovative communications solution for the smart grid. They have been the world market leader in the powerline segment since 1998 and stand for innovative premium network products. Despite their success and the complex challenges in a dynamic market environment, they have remained an owner-operated company.




Their employees are the basis of success and high worldwide reputation. A big percentage of the workforce is employed in IT development, so they are continuously working on improving technology with their own, patented solutions and this is to make their products more powerful, secure, energy efficient and environmentally friendly. The IT environment at our respected client is high-tech, entrepreneurial and fast-paced. Individual and creative contributions to the company objectives are highly encouraged and recognized. There will be an abundance of opportunities to develop new Full Stack .NET C# and Windows skills and to benefit from interaction with a highly experienced leadership team(s).




The Full Stack Developer




Currently a special R&D team of our respected client is engaged in developing a new industrial platform. Hence, they are looking for Full Stack (C#) software engineers/ developers who have the experience to take the lead in the development of Windows applications that are new to their department. In this multidiscipline project, the developers will create industrial IT Windows applications and departmental skills and working methods.




An Overview Of Some Duties And Responsibilities




 * Develop Windows software applications.
 * Get involved with the development of new platform software for the industrial systems integration.
 * Design, code and unit-test new features.
 * Tune the system specifications and high-level design in order to optimize design effort.
 * Take ownership of plan, planning, and design of software components.
 * Debug and diagnose software issues in existing software, including working with Support Engineer to resolve customer issues
 * Communicate to project stakeholders on design decisions and project status.
 * Cooperate internationally within the project team.
 * Acquire and implement knowledge on new technology relevant.
 * Perform code reviews for your peer developers.
 * Inspire and share your experience with your colleagues.




An Overview Of Some Desired Skills And Experiences




 * Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems.
 * Experience in development using C#, MVC, Entity Framework, SQL Server, JavaScript frameworks, HTML, CSS, and JQuery.
 * You have a deep understanding of how a cloud-based application/system works.
 * You have been working on large scale distributed/cloud systems for at least 3 years and have been engineering solutions for at least 5 years.
 * Excellent understanding of software design and development using SOLID principles.
 * Experience with agile development methodologies.
 * Experience with ASP.NET Web API.
 * Strong Unit Testing experience.




Perks




 * A team of world-class designers, developers, engineers, and product strategists who build ‘Next Generation’ software for respected brands.
 * A fast-paced environment that exposes you to challenging situations and solutions.
 * A chance to be a member of a fast-growing team looking to define the next paradigms of product quality and software development.
 * An opportunity to improve on the edges of Windows application fields and continuously broaden your knowledge and development skills.
 * The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology.
 * Awesome workmates.
 * Competitive salary.




Offered




Just like most clients of SDP, our client will offer C# professionals a tailor-made package of secondary benefits. Salary is being determined on the C# development/ engineer level and they always strive to overbid current salary indications. Due to the continuous growth of the client company there are many opportunities to develop further and grow.




Are you interested? Please forward your CV to mario@servicedrivenprofessionals.nl or call +31 (0)6 10 29 91 58. Also, for additional questions you are welcome to get in contact.




Met vriendelijke groet/ Kind regards,




Mario John Lemmers BSc.




Service Driven Professionals | Senior IT Staffing Consultant




 * e-mail: mario@servicedrivenprofessionals.nl mob: +31 (0)6 10 29 91 58 tel: +31 (0)20 895 09 52 skype: mario.john.lemmers website: www.servicedrivenprofessionals.nl

description:

With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.




📄 Job Description




Today we are looking for a Backend Developer to join the CRM Brands product team (within the Sales Preparation domain and Sales Creation tribe). The aim of CRM Brands product is to help sourcing team to improve Supplier’s relationship and to better track their activities in order to enhance business and margin, the product is used by internal users for all Veepee online sales.




TECH




 * .NETCore 3.1 / .NET6 / Golang
 * PgSql / RabbitMq / Kafka
 * Elastic / Kibana / Grafana
 * Gitlab CI / Docker / Kubernetes
 * Salesforce
   
   

🎯 TASKS




 * Develop new and redesign existing features of our products
 * Suggest on interfaces and other possible improvements that might be doneWrite technical documentation
 * Keep the code clean and review your team members’ designs if needed
 * Ensure the reliability and scalability of developed applications
 * Respect the production deadlines

👉 MUST HAVE skills

If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?

Vente-privee.com processes the collected data to handle the recruitment process, and to evaluate your ability to carry out the job offered and your professional skills. You can learn more about our use of your data and your rights by reading our recruiting privacy policy.

title: Software Engineer (.NET)
description:
For our local Research & Development team based in Utrecht, Netherlands, we are looking for a talented and passionate all-round .NET software engineer.




You will be joining our local R&D team where you will work on different projects to improve and innovate our products for Healthcare & Enterprise.




The local team’s main responsibility is developing and maintaining a variety of desktop-, web-, and mobile applications, Interfaces and add-ons to our standard products and solutions.




You will be part of the local scrum team, but you will collaborate with other R&D teams in the Netherlands, USA, Sweden, Romania and other places.




Your Responsibilities Include




Participate in development projects as software developer.




Create documentation for your own designs and implementation. Verifying your own code and participate in the verification of the complete software product. Developing and maintaining your own competence.




Here at Ascom…




You’re not just a number, you’re a person with aspirations and that’s important to us. You can drive your own career and we’re here to help you do that by providing career progression through learning and development, internal opportunities, and being part of global and local initiatives and projects. But don’t take our word for it, just ask some of our team members who have been with us for over 20 years!




Giving you a real-world, first-hand experience about what it’s like to work with technology that is at the forefront of the healthcare industry. Making a difference and having an impact on the lives in your community.




We expect you need the following skills, knowledge and experience...




 * Bachelor or master degree (HBO or University) in computer science, engineering or adequate work experience.
 * Experience with the Microsoft platform and software development in C#.
 * Interest in a broad range of development areas like back-end coding, API development, front-end development and apps.

Desired qualifications:




 * Experience with main web-standards like RESTful services.

 * Experience with SQL.
 * Experience with working with code repositories like Git.
 * Experience with Unit-testing frameworks.




What’s it like to work at Ascom?




We love challenges and to build things that we are proud of, especially when products are used for life saving purposes. Everyone at Ascom matters and are highly valued. Why not check out some of our Employee testimonials on our careerpage. Are you interested in joining us? Brian Bonouvrié (Head of R&D) is interested in hearing all about you and look forward to receiving your application.




If you have any questions in the meantime, just ask Brian at Brian.Bonouvrie@ascom.com




Good to know

We are…




A global solutions provider focused on Healthcare ICT and mobile workflow solutions. Headquartered in Switzerland, our business spans across 18 countries, and has been supporting the healthcare industry for close to 160 years by providing them with technology to enable them to support their communities. Together we can make a difference in the lives of the people who benefit from our technology.




To learn more about what we do, visit us at: www.ascom.com

title: PHP Developer
description:
We connect @CM.com




CM.com is a fast growing, listed, and global tech company. We offer over 40 software products to our customers, which you’ve probably already touched by receiving text or WhatsApp messages, buying tickets for festivals or while chatting via an AI chatbot for your support questions. We help create the ultimate customer experience for our customers to you, the end user.




All techy stuff, but we believe in people that make the difference. And that is exactly what our bright bunch of ambitious caring colleagues do. Every day. Together. Entrepreneurial people are the beating heart of our club. And this way, we can take on any challenge that comes our way. Our credo has been the same since the beginning in 1999 : “Do what you like, do what you’re good at, and contribute.”




What You Will Do




You will work in a team of 4 senior developers with a focus on PHP back end development in the Ticketing domain. Selling Tickets is one of the roots of CM.com and in this product we focus on Museums and Parks across the Netherlands. Our ambition is to grow more internationally, different countries, different currencies and therefore other challenges in scalability, security and infra. Current clients are: Van Gogh Museum, Moco, Paleis 't Loo, Toverland, Formula 1 Heineken Dutch Grand Prix.




You will mainly work on back end development in PHP 8, combined with some DevOps work in Google Cloud (Server management). This is an agile team, following SCRUM principles but does not follow the SCRUM rules 100%. The ticketing business can be volatile and therefore priorities can switch during the weeks. The variety of switching between departments, triaging bugs and investigating new solutions for problems is valued by the team.




You connect with us, if you




 * Bachelor level of working and thinking;
 * Minimum 3+ years of PHP experience. Symphony framework and Google Cloud knowledge is a plus
 * Fluent in English as this is the main language; Dutch is a plus
 * We like to work from the office, so living on travel distance from Rembrandt Park is a must




Benefits of working @CM.comDuring our Global Onboarding program we want you and all our other new Club Members to have a complete deep dive into the culture of CM.com. An exciting program will be waiting for you! To keep you connected with your colleagues we organize the global “Convention Weeks” in our headquarters in Breda filled with informative, practical, and fun activities. Furthermore we come together as a club during the Friday afternoon drinks, and our Healthy Free office breakfast and lunch.




 * Your salary is a given, and we offer a pension plan of 8% of your monthly salary, 25 holidays, holiday allowance and if you need to travel we got you covered.
 * You have the possibility to participate in our Employee Share Purchase Program and get a discount on purchasing company shares.
 * And if you want to develop yourself professionally we offer internal and/or external training courses like Udemy and the CM Academy. To promote knowledge sharing we organize different types of Meet-Ups with external speakers.




Ready to join the Club? Apply now!Yes! Apply via the company website and the assigned Recruiter will be in touch. Ready to join the club?




AND we are transparent, humble, and approachable regardless of age, culture, background, gender or religion e.g. Everyone is allowed backstage and allowed on the VIP deck, together.

title: Front end Developer | €78.000 obv 36 uur + bonus
description:
Jouw baan: Front end Developer Amsterdam




 * Wil jij graag deel uitmaken van een revolutionaire missie waarbij je impact maakt op miljoenen reizigers wereldwijd?
 * Wat vind je van om te werken aan mission-critical systemen die echt het technische hart uitmaken binnen deze organisatie?
 * Lijkt het jou leuk om dit product tevens in parallel compleet opnieuw te bouwen in TypeScript & modern JS, binnen een micorservices/cloud architectuur op grote schaal?
 * En wat vind je van een fulltime werkweek van 36 uur (4x9), hybride werken & waar je altijd kunt parkeren als je toch op kantoor werkt?

Klinkt dit als jou volgende uitdaging? Lees dan snel verder!




Jouw werkgever: Bouwt tastbare mission-critical systemen voor miljoenen reizigers




Dit zeer stabiele bedrijf dat iedereen kent, richt zich op een revolutionaire missie dat probeert vooraan de innovatiecurve te staan als het gaat rondom wereldwijd reizen. Iedereen die jij kent heeft wel eens gebruikt gemaakt van de tastbare systemen die ze hier bouwen. Men is hier een nieuwe strategische weg ingeslagen voor de aankomende jaren, namelijk een slimmere en efficiëntere manier om de systemen te ontwikkelen. Door een nieuwe infrastructuur te bouwen waar de organisatie veel makkelijker en sneller kan deployen, kan men op een zeer duurzame, veilige en schaalbare manier vele malen sneller feedback op de systemen die ze bouwen. Jij krijgt dus direct feedback op jouw werk omtrent menselijk verkeer. Hoe gaaf is dat? Mensen blijven bewezen langer werken doordat ze hier divers pallet aan technische vraagstukken kunnen oplossen waardoor men hier een nog betere leercurve doormaakt. Daarnaast is work-life balance één van de belangrijkste waarden binnen dit bedrijf. Zo hanteert men hier een 36-urige werkweek, waar je zelfs 4x9 mag werken! Kortom, veel afwisseling in je werk, lekker veel leren en ten alle tijden de work-life balance gewaarborgd.




Jouw rol: Front end Developer Amsterdam




Als Front end Developer Amsterdam krijg je de kans om te werken aan één van de meest mission-critical systemen binnen de gehele organisatie. Sterker nog, als deze applicatie niet werkt, kan het gehele bedrijf niet opereren. Jij bent dus echt één van de key-spelers binnen de organisatie! Bovendien gaan ze dit tastbare mission-critical product volledig opnieuw bouwen in de nabije toekomst naast het bestaande product. Jij krijgt de unieke kans om dit product volledig vanaf scratch te bouwen! Jij mag dus je tanden zetten in de micorservices architectuur, development, deployment in de cloud, verbeteringen en alles wat er nog meer bij komt kijken om dit product nog beter te laten worden dan de huidige.




Doorgroeimogelijkheden




De teams kennen zoals gezegd geen tot weinig roulatie doordat er genoeg uitdaging is, er onbegrensde doorgroeimogelijkheden zijn binnen verschillende productteams & mensen de breedte in kunnen groeien. Als Senior Front end Developer krijg je de kans om intern te switchen binnen verschillende teams en door te groeien naar Team Lead, Architect of zelfs managementniveau.




Wat wordt er gevraagd?




 * Minimaal 3+ jaar professionele Front end development ervaring
 * Ervaring met TypeScript in productie!
 * Ervaring met RxJS, Docker/Kubernetes is een pre
 * Ervaring met event-driven-architecturen is een pre
 * Je bent een teamspeler en communicatief sterk
 * Woonachtig & werkend in Europa




Wat wordt er geboden?




 * Salaris tot €78.000 obv 36 uur adhv toegevoegde waarde (+6% fixed bonus)
 * Werk 36 uur per week (4x9!!)
 * Flexibele werktijden
 * Remote werken (2 dagen op kantoor)

title: Junior Software Engineer | Incore Software
description:
Wat ga jij doen?




Wat Worden Je Werkzaamheden




Wij zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste en gedreven (junior) Software Engineer. Als (junior) Software Engineer bouw je mee aan onze applicatie die o.a. bij Bol.com, Jumbo, FootLocker en Suitsupply in bedrijfskritische processen gebruikt wordt. We bieden hierbij technisch uitdagend werk wat je alleen of samen met de andere software engineers uitvoert.




 * Schrijven en aanpassen van software
 * Peer reviews
 * Unit testing
 * Onderzoek en analyse bij storingen
 * Deployment
 * Overige voorkomende werkzaamheden




Waar kom je te werken?




Je komt te werken bij Incore Software, het leukste softwarebedrijf van Amsterdam. Op een steenworp afstand van het Centraal Station vind je ons kantoor, in de Beurs van Berlage. Hier werken we met ons team van 40 specialisten aan de Supply Chain Portal. Incore Software heeft een leidende rol in de Supply Chain en is snel aan het groeien.




Wij werken voor klanten zoals Bol.com, Jumbo supermarkten, Foot Locker en Suitsupply. Deze klanten ga je helpen om meer inzage te krijgen in hun totale supply chain. Wij halen energie uit het gezamenlijk met de klant oplossen van complexe logistieke problemen en bieden jou de kans om je snel te ontwikkelen. We zijn een jong en ambitieus team en werken graag op een hoog niveau met elkaar samen, maar er is ook genoeg ruimte voor gezelligheid tijdens en na werktijd.




Zowel thuis- als op kantoor werken behoren bij de mogelijkheden. Het is een bedrijf waar veel kan en mag. Er is ruimte voor eigen ontwikkeling en initiatief. Wij geloven in on-the-job training, dus na een korte inwerkperiode zal je al snel werken aan echte projecten. Er zijn genoeg uitdagingen en je krijgt hierbij veel eigen verantwoordelijkheid.




Wat wij vragen?




 * HBO-diploma (maar dan behoorde je wel bij de top) of een universitaire masteropleiding in een relevant vakgebied
 * Goede IT vaardigheden 2
 * Ervaring met C# is een pré
 * Nederlands en Engels spreken, lezen en schrijven




Wat wij bieden?




 * Werken in een jong en enthousiast bedrijf
 * Een goed salaris, netto thuiswerkvergoeding en een reiskostenvergoeding
 * Flexibele werkuren
 * De mogelijkheid om thuis te werken
 * Na 12 maanden een vast contract

title: Backend software engineer
description:
Here's the tl;dr:

 * We are on a mission to make programming biology easy. We provide biologists with the software, machine learning & services to discover, design and optimise enzymes and their cell-factories to ultimately produce almost anything.
 * We're an experienced team. We have built many successful products before and we have raised enough funds to have plenty of runway for the years to come!
 * We're focused on building the best possible team culture. We're distributed across two locations, and are flexible about when and where we work.
 * We offer top of the market salary, a generous equity stake in the company and a wide range of benefits from health and wellbeing, financial, to training and career progression opportunities.
   
   

This is Cradle

Cradle helps teams to engineer proteins with fewer, more successful experiments. We use generative machine learning models, accessible through user-friendly software interfaces, to help engineer protein properties such as stability, expression, activity, binding affinity and specificity. We are bridge builders who bring together the best of machine learning, synthetic biology, developer tools, and user experience design. Our mission is to enable a world where most of the products around us can be easily made and degraded biologically using a cell-factory instead of (petro-)chemicals, plants or animal agriculture.

In software we have an almost infinite degree of freedom on designing solutions. We at Cradle want to use this flexibility to provide a new level of experience for biological engineers. These engineers work on optimising proteins (sequences of amino acids), which currently includes a lot of expert knowledge and manual steps. We want to revolutionise their processes and build a ‘photoshop for proteins’ supported by machine learning. On that mission we deal with complex user objectives, diverse data structures and physical lab interactions while offering an easy to use, low code user interface.

What we are looking for

For this challenge we are looking for backend software engineers who are excited to peek out of the virtual world and join us on designing a platform for optimizing biological systems. Be ready to witness first hand what happens when you leave the bits and bytes behind and try to solve challenges with nature’s constraints and complexity.

Responsibilities:

As a backend software engineer, you will be responsible to:

 * Develop a decoupled, service oriented platform application powered by sophisticated machine learning tools
 * Support the team in establishing a stable, high quality and flexible software engineering process
 * Collaborate with biologists, machine learning experts and scientists alike and learn to understand their domain
   
   

Need to haves

 * Strong algorithmic and problem solving skills
 * You have proven track record of developing back-end systems in a modern cloud environment.
 * You have excellent knowledge of software development best practices, including code reviews, version control, and CI/CD pipelines.
 * You write readable code. Cradle aims to build a team of excellent computer scientists which includes advanced coding skills. We are set but not fixed on coding in Python at the moment.
 * You are able to communicate well. We are working at the intersection of biology and software where good communication is key.
 * You are kind and work well in teams. We look for team players who contribute to a positive and friendly working environment.
   
   

Nice to haves

 * Extensive knowledge of the Python programming language and its ecosystem.
 * A solid understanding of application development lifecycle, testing principles, and agile practices.
 * You have worked with databases or big data systems.
 * You have been working on production systems for machine learning applications.
 * Experience in building containerized backend systems using Docker and Kubernetes.
   
   

Cradle helps biologists design improved proteins in record time using powerful prediction algorithms and AI design suggestions.

We use generative machine learning models, accessible through user-friendly software interfaces, to help engineer protein properties such as stability, expression, activity, binding affinity and specificity. Our mission is to ultimately help more people build with biology and replacing traditional farms and factories for a more sustainable world.

You will be joining a high-growth, highly ambitious startup with an experienced founding team, whose motivation is building a more sustainable world using biology. We are backed by some of the most well known investors and industry veterans. Joining us now means you will be getting in on the ground floor; you will have a significant impact on how we shape the company, and success will mean an outsized reward.

Did we pique your interest? We'd love to hear from you. Please use this form to apply directly.

title: Software Developer - Create software that will revolutionize museums, cinemas, and festivals.
description:
INTK is an ambitious studio based in Utrecht (25 minutes from Amsterdam). We are specialized in developing digital strategies for cultural organizations.




We work with museums, theaters, film houses, castles, libraries, festivals, etc. Some of the cultural organizations we work with are: Guggenheim Museum, Stadsschouwburg Utrecht, Film Theater Hilversum, Loevestein Castle, Library Utrecht, Le Guess Who festival, etc.




Our mission is to change how people relate to culture. We are inspired by the transformation that happened in the sports sector. Forty years ago, very few people sported. Today, many people dedicate several hours a week to sport. We would like to bring a similar change to the cultural sector. Our goal is to encourage people who love culture to engage in cultural activities on a weekly basis. For example, we want to encourage people that love cinema and rock concerts to go every week to the cinema and once a month to a rock concert.




We are a young team of international professionals. You will be assigned high responsibility tasks from day one. Every Monday, we analyze the success of the previous week and plan the upcoming. We have lunch together every day. On Fridays, the entire team joins for drinks as we stop working half an hour earlier.




Tasks




We work on a combination of three products: ClapApp, CultureToday, and CultureCab.




ClapApp - Personal assistant for your cultural life




Every city needs an app that allows you to see all the cultural activities available. It should work like Deliveroo, Uber eats, etc. You should be able to browse the cultural agenda of your city, buy tickets, and schedule events together with friends.




The app will need to have a database with all the cultural activities. There are two approaches to getting that database. We have an army of people copy/pasting all cultural activities into the database or automating the process.




ClapApp will be your assistant when it comes to your cultural life. It will alert you when there is a new movie from your favorite director or a new concert from your favorite band.




CultureToday - Marketing Digital Assistant




Online marketing is growing bigger and bigger. All cultural organizations could use a marketing assistant. The assistant could automatically create presentations with the marketing results, automatically create campaigns and write monthly reports to be sent by email.




This full-stack project allows you to work with data, APIs, VUE, etc.




CultureCab - CMS for culture




CultureCab is our internal name for an adaptation of a Python/React CMS (Volto) that we use to create websites for cultural organizations. Check out some of the work we have done:




Requirements




Are you interested in working on a high-impact and short-term project to positively impact thousands of people? Are you passionate about creating software that stretches the limits of technology and beauty? If so, we have the perfect job opportunity for you.




Depending on your expertise and experience, we will together find the right fit and topic which could be Web-development (ReactJS, Angular, Python, Plone, Volto), data analysis (Google Apps Script, Google Sheets, Data Studio), or another topic you want to propose.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Who we are:




Irdeto is the world leader in digital platform cybersecurity, empowering businesses to innovate for a secure, connected future. Building on over 50 years of expertise in security, Irdeto’s services and solutions protect revenue, enable growth and fight cybercrime in video entertainment, video games, and connected industries including transport, health and infrastructure. Irdeto is the security partner dedicated to empowering a secure world where people can connect with confidence.




With teams and offices around the world, Irdeto’s greatest asset is its people - our diversity is celebrated through an inclusive workplace, where everyone has an equal opportunity to drive innovation and contribute to Irdeto's success.




The Role:




As a Junior Software Engineer/Full Stack, you will work in a scrum team to design, implement, and validate our web service host platform that is used by Irdeto internal and external customers. You will be exposed to various tools and technologies, such as React, Angular, JavaScript, Python, DynamoDB, NodeJS, AWS, Git, Auth0.




Your mission at Irdeto:




 * Foster a professional engineering culture and help to grow our standards, by keeping your industry knowledge on software development up-to-date and spread that in the organization.
 * Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to define and implement software requirements.
 * Participate in the entire software development lifecycle, from planning and design to implementation, testing, and deployment.
 * Develop, improve, maintain and document clean code, in an agile manner, as part of a Scrum Team.
 * Practice DevOps mindset, you build it, you run it.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and improve development processes.




How you can add value to the team:




 * BSc/MSc degree of Computer Science or related technical degree or equivalent experience.
 * 1+ years of experience as a Full Stack Engineer, with a strong focus on both frontend and backend development.
 * Good knowledge of frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
 * Good knowledge of backend technologies such as Node.js, Python or similar languages.
 * Experience working with databases (e.g., DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB) and proficiency in writing efficient database queries.
 * Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
 * Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
 * Good problem-solving and analytical skills, with a strong attention to detail.
 * Communication and collaboration abilities, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
 * Willingness to learn new technologies and what is required for a job.
 * Highly organized, thorough, and motivated professional.




What you can expect from us:




Our people and culture are the heart of our business, and our values of Trust, Accountability, Agility and Innovation inform what we do, and how we work. We believe in investing in our talented employees and promote collaboration, creativity and innovation, health and well-being across our global workforce.




 




In addition to competitive remuneration and extensive benefits we offer:




 * An international and multicultural environment where diversity and inclusivity are celebrated and embraced 
 * Professional educational opportunities and training program
 * Innovation sabbatical
 * Volunteer Day
 * State of the art office space
 * On the job coaching and mentoring
 * Flexible work arrangements – via our Work Hard Anywhere policy.
 * Some of us run city marathons and even go on snowboarding trips together!
 * Casual Friday? Casual every day!
 * US$ 500 net for your home office setup after you passed your trial period
 * And many additional perks customized to global locations (canteen, fresh fruit, amazing coffee, parking, on-site gym, yoga room to name a few)




Irdeto encourages applications from people with disabilities, as we provide accommodation on request of the candidates that take part in all aspects of the selection processes.




Welcome to Irdeto!




Irdeto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Front-end engineer
description:
The Customer Data Area within ING Bank NL. The products and services of Customer Data are essential for the everyday financial needs of our customers. Without access to data of our customers for all customer journeys in the bank, customer cannot see their data, perform a transaction on their (current) account, close a mortgage or get a business loan; all journeys would fail without access to data of our customers. To ensure our customers are in control, we also enable a smooth administration of their personal data (name, address, etc) and the roles and mandates. We do so for businesses and private individuals. We are responsible for the development of the web features for offering best in-class digital experience to our customers. Within Customer Data our teams are responsible for all digital flows to manage customer data via self-service or via assisted services. Therefore, one can truly state: the products and services from the Customer Data are at the oxygen of all customer interactions with the bank.




A highly motivated engineer who likes to work in an international multidisciplinary team of engineers and business colleagues. Next to your work in the team, you also like to contribute to the mastery of other engineers and improve the way of work within ING.




You are a competent full stack engineer with a focus on front-end development. You are a hardcore JavaScript developer who has experience with TypeScript, NodeJS and NPM. You have knowledge of, and/or experience with, the latest JavaScript versions and Web Components concepts and technology with lit-html and lit-element. You have experience with applying (front-end) design patterns and architecture. Beside that you are familiar with backend technology like REST API’s, Java Spring and cloud technologies.




We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious, will keep learning and will take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.




 * A Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field
 * 4-5 years of software engineering experience, preferably in creating highly scalable, secure and high-performance applications

 * Good knowledge of front end frameworks and working experience in developing Web components using one or more frameworks of Angular 8 +, ReactJS, Polymer and/or Lit-HTML/Lit-Element
 * Experience with setting up your own pipeline configuration

Furthermore, you have great analytical skills and conceptual understanding. You are able to quickly understand new technical concepts and technology and you have a strong interest in, and vision on, the latest trends in software development and technology. You have strong communication skills that enable you to explain complex technical concepts to non-techies. Your English in speaking and writing is fluent and you are a team player who likes to join the social events of the squad and ING organization.




 * Inititial 12 month contract assignment with option to extension

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
About The Job




At TimeEdit we believe in context not control; we will set you up for success and watch you soar.




Backed by leading SaaS investors from Scandanavia, our educational platform is at the heart of every Higher Education institution solving conflict problems while improving student and staff's overall experience.




With over 20 years of experience in the domain, we are now on a growth journey. Having expanded out of Scandanavia, TimeEdit has a base of 190+ education institutions and is growing rapidly all over the world.




We are looking for a new Software Engineer to join our amazing team in Utrecht.




The mission




Most will agree that universities and colleges are quintessential to a well-functioning society. However, with their inherent operational complexity and immense size, they are among the most difficult organisations to run efficiently. TimeEdit is on a mission to solve this by delivering the most comprehensive suite of efficient resource management tools to the higher education sector globally. We are the fastest growing provider in the industry and are expanding rapidly with new implementations in the Netherlands, Belgium, Australia, New Zealand, to name a few. More and more universities are discovering TimeEdit to solve their scheduling, resource management and academic operation needs.




The challenge




With the market transitioning away from legacy monoliths, Excel spreadsheets and home-grown has-beens, the TimeEdit Engineering team plays a pivotal role in defining the next generation of digital tools for universities across the globe to use. To accelerate our growth journey, we are looking for another set of capable hands to join our team and help develop the timetabling and resource management products of tomorrow.




The role




As a Software Engineer At TimeEdit, You Will




 * Be part of an empowered engineering team consisting of an Engineering Manager and 3-5 software engineers, delivering a product used by more than 1 million students, faculty and staff
 * Work with a product that redefines how universities and colleges approach scheduling, and has the potential to truly disrupt the operational capabilities of the higher education sector
 * Create, innovate and develop the product in accordance with the product’s roadmap and strategy defined
 * Continuously work with team and company leadership to develop our processes, workflows and tools to make sure our culture and employee satisfaction is as cutting edge as the products we like to build




Your day-to-day




 * Ship your own and your team’s code to different environments with autonomy
 * Conduct sprint planning and help crafting technical specifications to complement the PMs business requirements
 * Participate, lead and help improve TimeEdit’s agile, empowered, development process
 * Reflect and evaluate on how we can keep improving our methodology, our culture, and the business value and outcomes we deliver
 * Be part of an exciting and challenging growth journey together with some of the world's most talented Engineers, Product Managers, Customer Success managers and Sales representatives




We urge you to apply if you..




 * Have 3+ years experience with Java and frameworks such as Spring and Hibernate
 * Have experience within a SaaS company that delivers a cloud-based product
 * Possess a strong understanding of modern best practices for web application development, ideally with React for front-end development
 * Have worked with PostgreSQL or similar relational databases
 * Hands-on experince with a cloud provider such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
 * Possess great communication skills; fluent in Dutch and English, verbal and written




We believe you are an individual who can and wants to contribute with your own ideas and challenge our way of thinking. We believe that you enjoy “blank canvas” problem solving, and consider yourself a self-starter. We are a company with high ambitions, and we believe that you have them too.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
About Us




Agap2 is a European IT Consultancy, active in 14 countries with over 8.000 employees. The company was founded in Portugal and since 2014 we are based in the Netherlands with our Amsterdam office to provide our IT expertise to the Dutch market. Our employees are defined by the so-called “Agapian spirit”, which is summarized in 5 keywords: family, union, friendship, team spirit, and learning.




Did you identify with what defines us? Then read on to find out more!




The position




As a Frontend Developer at Agap2, you take on the challenge within an international environment with a local focus. You will have the opportunity to work on various projects along the years, based on your experience and interests. Projects within industries such as Banking, Fintech, Telco, Retail, Sports and Healthcare.




While working at agap2 you are expected to share your knowledge while also having the opportunity to learn new technologies. We believe that sharing knowledge is the key to personal development. Our talent management program is tailor-made to give you the opportunity to develop and grow in your career, the way you envision it. Because we work with various customers, you are also expected to be able to adapt to different environments.




What You Bring To The Position




In addition to the required technical knowledge, it is important that consultants share our vision and fit within our company culture. Your personal and professional development is key, while you take on various challenges with our customers. As a Frontend Consultant you also have the following:




 * At least 4 years of professional experience as a Frontend Developer
 * At least 3 years of professional experience with React, Angular or Vue.js
 * Experience with TypeScript and modern JavaScript ES6
 * Experience with application state management (Redux or similar) and RxJS library
 * Experience in writing Unit tests (Jasmine/ Jest Spectator / React Testing Library)
 * Experience with Agile/Scrum
 * You have strong communication skills and a fluent command of the English language
 * You are a team player. Want to share, dare to learn!
   




It is an advantage if you have




 * Good command of the Dutch language
 * Experience with APIs
 * Experience working with Cloud technology, Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Github
   




What We Offer




 * Competitive salary
 * Full travel allowance
 * Pension plan
 * 25 vacation days
 * Laptop and mobile phone
 * Tailor-made talent management program to help you achieve your professional goals
 * Weekly Dutch classes (for the non-Dutch speakers)
 * Pleasant and informal working atmosphere within an international organization
 * Challenging projects based on your interests and experience
 * Room for own input and ideas
 * Access to tech events and meetups
 * Legendary Meetings
   




Is there still room for fun? Of course! The combination of fun and development is essential in our team. A small impression: our team consists of more than 10 nationalities, we play football and regularly organize tech meetups, Friday afternoon drinks, and pub quizzes.




At agap2 we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees. All candidates with skills matching the position are welcome to join us!

title: Medior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer | €75.000 + 10% bonus + remote options
description:
Your job: Medior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer Amsterdam




 * Do you want to make an impact from the start within an organization, where you build and improve a scalable system & with a small and autonomous team?
 * Would you like to be a Front end Developer building mainly in React, TypeScript and also have Back end Node responsibilities?
 * Have you always wanted to work with an experienced CTO who contributed to Amazon's growth when the company was still under the radar?
 * How about working in a start-up environment with lots of freedom and ownership of the product, but under the wings of a successful & stable parent company that has been in the market for 15 years, good terms, and one of the nicest offices in Amsterdam (if you don't work from home)?

Sounds good, right? Don't wait any longer and read on!




Your employer: Build a high-performance and scalable system from the ground up that processes over 1 billion requests per day!




Since the beginning of the online world, this market has been growing continuously. The innovative parent company of this Amsterdam-based tech company has been capitalizing on this development by helping their clients maximize the potential of online. The organization is driven by innovation and continuous growth and learning, both for the organization and the people. This is reflected in, for example, a generous training budget and participation in conferences. It is a medium-sized company with a product that is going to make an impact on a huge number of customers and which lies under the wings of an already successful parent company. Yet the size is still small enough to taste and feel the scale-up atmosphere and, for example, to be able to have a lot of autonomy and impact on the end result. They are now gearing up for further success by building their own online technology platform, which will process over half a billion requests a day! You'll be targeting a very specific niche that is in high demand, with customers already lining up. And you'll help design, engineer, and build from the ground up! So the stage the organization is at is very interesting to get into. You'll have a lot of impact and ownership within the product and also be able to really contribute to the growth of yourself and the platform.




Your role: Medior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer Amsterdam




As a Medior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer Amsterdam, you'll get the chance to work in a team with a very experienced and smart CTO, who has contributed to the growth of one of the most well-known tech companies worldwide. Together with him and several other Developers, you will be responsible for designing and building the new online platform and then continuing to take the system to the next level. The main stack used is React, TypeScript, Node as well as Kafka, Kubernetes, and GCP. The highly available and scalable system is built in a microservices architecture and you get a lot of freedom to contribute to building the MVP (Minimal Viable Product) with your own input. Tech stack: React, TypeScript, Node, Kafka, Kubernetes & GCP




Growth opportunities




As the product grows, you as a Medior can grow into a Senior are be able to contribute to the expansion of the teams and you may even grow into the role of Tech Lead in the future.




What is required?




 * 3+ years of professional software development experience
 * Experienced in React, TypeScript & Node
 * Node experience and experience with data structures & algorithms is a plus
 * Good communication & clear explanation
 * A BSc or higher degree (or demonstrable comparable work experience)
 * Experience with GCP and/or Kubernetes is a big plus
 * Experience with building CI/CD pipelines




What is offered?




 * Between €60,000 and €70,000 gross per annum, based on experience and added value
 * The opportunity to work 32, 36, or 40 hours
 * 10% year-end bonus
 * Solid pension
 * 25 holiday days
 * Flexible working hours & possibilities to work from home
 * MacBook
 * Packed lunches
 * Solid budget for training, conferences, and books




Do you see yourself as a Medior Full-Stack JavaScript Developer Amsterdam already being of great value in building and continuously improving a scalable system?




Then apply directly using the form below or email your CV to Melchior Schimmel via m.schimmel@codeguild.nl

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
You might not realize it but digital out-of-home is all around you; from the billboards in Times Square, to the TVs at gas pumps, screens at electric vehicle charging stations, elevators, the grocery check-out aisle and everything in between. Our mission is to power that global digital signage ecosystem. We’ve built software solutions that can run entire signage networks and an end-to-end marketplace for programmatic advertising exclusively for digital out-of-home.




About us:




Vistar Media is a rapidly growing global software & advertising technology company. In addition to our industry leading technology (we’ve been recognized as AdExchanger’s 2021 & 2020 Top Programmatic Power Players, and Street Fight’s Innovator Awards’ Best Ad Platform 2019, among others), we’re proud of our team and the positive, supportive culture we’ve built. We’re scaling our teams globally; join us!




About Sage+Archer:




Sage+Archer (a Vistar Media company) is a leading European Demand Side Platform (DSP). Many well-known brands like Heineken, Disney, and Coca-Cola use our platform to buy digital advertising spaces on smartphones and digital billboards on the streets programmatically.




About the role:




A big part of Vistar’s mission is to make the screens out in the world (digital signage) smart enough to react to a variety of data inputs, and then use that data to build a dynamic, engaging experience on the fly. The connected devices team builds the backbone technology that powers internet-connected screens and other types of hardware.




We are currently seeking full-stack engineers to help grow our connected devices division. You'll be part of a team focused on IoT and Smart Cities projects. You will be part of a highly skilled engineering team and be able to make an immediate impact. As one of the early team members, you will play an integral role in shaping up our core technology. Your work will be highly visible and critical to our success. You will be exposed to a variety of technologies from networking to desktop applications on multiple operating systems and you will have the chance to learn and own parts of the system.




What you'll do:




 * Work collaboratively on a dynamic team to deliver solutions to complex problems
 * Write clean, maintainable, and testable code for high-reliability, distributed, desktop-like applications
 * Interface with clients for production support and requirements gathering
 * Daily design, development and debugging of local and remote systems
 * Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing
 * Take ownership of complex projects and deliver solutions with unclear or incomplete requirements; drive them forward to fill the gaps
 * Design scalable solutions in the IoT space where tens of thousands of devices connect at a time
   
   

What experience we're looking for:




 * 4-10+ years of experience in software development
 * Experience with the full stack—from the database to CSS
 * Expertise in at least one compiled, one interpreted language, and one web framework
 * Expert in JavaScript, TypeScript, and Node.js
 * Highly proficient with Python, RESTful APIs, microservices, and React
 * GoLang and AWS is a plus
 * Expertise in web technologies
 * Experience with developing complex software systems with production quality deployment, monitoring, and reliability
 * Understand HTTP and Websockets
 * Be able to decompose complex business requirements into a working solution
 * Experience with signage technologies, embedded devices, IoT devices, connected screens, and advertising is preferred
   
   

What we offer:




 * Commuting expenses are covered
 * 25 vacation days
 * Quarterly lifestyle stipend
 * Pension scheme
 * Global Exchange Program
 * Open business culture: we facilitate teams working together in our open workspaces and sharing their own ideas and vision. Also, we share our company vision and state every month with a company update
 * A comfortable office space with a lot of daylight, big adjustable desks, and good office chairs. Want to change your scenery every now and then? We also offer comfy sofas, community tables, and meeting rooms
 * Be part of a fast-growing technology company where you can benefit from a steep learning curve. Be at the forefront of the programmatic revolution of DOOH and mobile
 * International team and presence in Berlin, London, and Amsterdam
 * Lunch is provided every day with a lookout over the Amsterdam IJ water
 * A motivated and fun group of colleagues who like to do drinks on Fridays, participate in pub quizzes, and look out for each other
   




If you’re ambitious, highly driven and interested in making a big impact at a rapidly growing company, Vistar is the place for you. Apply to join our team!




Recruiting fraud is a serious issue facing jobseekers. Please be aware that Vistar Media would never require personal information (such as bank account information) during the interview process. Should an employee from Vistar Media reach out to you, that communication will come from an @vistarmedia.com email address. During a typical interview process, you will have several phone, video, and/or in-person interviews with multiple Vistar Media employees before a hiring decision is made. We do not require payment from applicants for training or other costs incurred, nor do we offer compensation before hiring.

title: Software Engineer, Systems or Compilers
description:
About Pagoda




Pagoda is shepherding a future where NEAR becomes the blockchain operating system. We believe that re-inventing how software is made and distributed is our greatest opportunity to open economic access to those who are not fully integrated into the global economy. Our products empower people to find opportunity, invent new experiences, and collaborate. Let's build an Open Web world. A world where people control their assets, data, and power of governance.




About The Role




The Protocol Engineering team at Pagoda is responsible for the infrastructure of the Layer 1 Blockchain, NEAR Protocol. We focus on building a scalable, performant, and reliable infrastructure to actualize visions of NEAR Protocol, including the Blockchain Operating System (BOS).




The core component of NEAR is a WebAssembly virtual machine that runs in a completely trustless and fully deterministic mode, as it executes contracts implemented in WebAssembly-friendly languages (e.g. Rust and Javascript) using a fast compiler. NEAR contributes a lot of effort into performance and safety optimizations of WebAssembly VMs/compilers which helps not only the NEAR protocol but the entire WebAssembly ecosystem.




We are looking for an Engineer with experience in low-level programming who is intrigued by a variety of open problems inherent to running compilers in completely trustless but high-performance settings, and who likes contributing to and collaborating with open-source communities.




What You'll Be Doing




In this role, you will be solving cutting-edge compiler and VM problems related to safe, deterministic, and high-performance compilation and execution. You will interface with many open-source projects where you might be asked to represent the NEAR organization. In the future, your work might also extend beyond WebAssembly VMs into other types of VMs that NEAR chooses to support. You'll work on a collaborative and globally distributed team of world class experienced engineers, providing an opportunity to learn and grow your technical skill set.




What We're Looking For




 * Knowledge and experience using Rust, C, or C++ in a production environment. We can teach you Rust if you are already a C or C++ expert
 * Familiarity with low-level programming (compilers, operating systems, hypervisors, etc)
 * Experience designing, maintaining, and debugging distributed systems built with open source tools
 * Solid foundation with Algorithms and Data Structures and their real world use cases
 * Demonstrated success working on a globally distributed team
 * Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related fields is a must




We'd Love If You Have




 * Contributions to open-source software
 * Experience with Rust API design
 * Experience with virtual machines




Here's What Our Interview Process Looks Like




Our interviews take place via Zoom and typically consists of the following stages:




 * Internal Recruiter Call (30 to 45 minutes)
 * Meet with the Hiring Manager (30-45 minutes)
 * Technical Interviews (4 x 60 minutes)
 * Pagoda Values Interview (30 to 45 minutes)




Benefits & Perks




 * Flexible Annual Leave / PTO with an encouraged 20 day per year minimum
 * Paid Holiday Week: the last week of the year
 * Paid Wellness Week: the first week of July
 * $2,000 Yearly Continued Education Reimbursement
 * $2,000 Home Office Setup Reimbursement
 * Co-working Space Reimbursement
 * Company Retreats (2023 in Spain!) & Team Offsites
 * Mental Health Support and access to licensed therapists through Spill, 100% paid by Pagoda




Our Values at Pagoda




Our values express our company culture. Learn more on our careers page.




Pagoda is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

title: Backend Developer
description:
Bij Crowdtech zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Backend Developer om ons team te komen versterken.

Als ervaren Backend Developer bouw je samen met het Development team aan onze web-based onderzoekssoftware: Crowdtech Insights. Jij schrijft software op basis van gedetailleerde specificaties. Daarnaast heb je ook ervaring met database werkzaamheden in een high performance omgeving. Natuurlijk zorg jij ervoor dat de software voldoet aan de eisen conform databeveiliging. Je werkt hierbij nauw samen met ervaren Backend Developers, Frontend Developers, Testers en de Product Owner.

Crowdtech verkleint zo samen met jou de kloof tussen organisaties en de consument.

Wat ga je doen?

De development afdeling bestaat uit 2 development teams, waarin 10 collega's samen volgens Scrum werken. De roadmap bestaat uit epics die een bijdrage moeten leveren aan de visie van het product Crowdtech Insight. Zo staan toegankelijkheid en innovatie bijvoorbeeld centraal.

 * De development teams zijn verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van onze software dat gebruikt wordt voor marktonderzoeksdoeleinden door onze 200
 * A-merk klanten en miljoenen respondenten. Je kunt hierbij denken aan online onderzoek zoals vragenlijsten, communities en dashboards.
 * Er wordt gewerkt met sprints van 2 weken. Aan het eind van elke sprint is er een demo en review waarin het development team de ontwikkelingen laat zien aan de stakeholders.
 * In de sprintplanning worden de werkzaamheden voor de komende 2 weken verdeeld onder de teams. Dit wordt gepland onder begeleiding van de Scrum Master en Product Owner.
 * Elke ochtend wordt gestart met een stand-up waar de development collega's hun werk kunnen overleggen.
 * De ontwikkeling vindt plaats in C# en MSSQL, met Javascript (VueJS) en HTML/ CSS. Verder werken we met grote hoeveelheden data, daarom is databaseonderhoud ook een onderdeel van de werkzaamheden.
 * Om het opgeleverde werk te testen, is er een staging omgeving ingericht waar ruim 2.000 automatische testen worden gedraaid voordat er een 'go' op livegang komt.
 * Het development team is meestal op dinsdag en woensdag aanwezig op kantoor in Amsterdam, en werkt dus geregeld vanuit huis.
 * Ambitieus? Daar is alle ruimte voor. Wij bieden, naast coaching door ervaren teamleden, de mogelijkheid je talent verder te laten ontwikkelen met trainingen en begeleiding.
   

Wie ben jij?

 * Je analytisch en hebt een passie voor IT, webdevelopment en databases.
 * Je houdt van innovatie.
 * Je bent een ervaren ontwikkelaar met minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring met backend projecten.
 * Je bent sterk in C# en MSSQL.
 * Ervaring met databaseonderhoud, Javascript (VueJS) en HTML/CSS zijn een pré.
 * Je bent een echte teamplayer.
 * Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Engels gaat je ook goed af.
   

Het team

Je komt in het development team van Crowdtech waarin iedereen zijn taak heeft en voor elkaar klaar staat, met als doel er een groot succes van te maken. Dit team is verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van onze software dat al 20 jaar gebruikt wordt voor marktonderzoeksdoeleinden door klanten zoals Achmea, Jumbo, Albert Heijn, HEMA, Heineken, NS, Wereld Natuur Fonds, etc. Je kunt hierbij denken aan online onderzoek zoals vragenlijsten, communities en dashboards.

Wat kun je verwachten?

Even voorstellen

Crowdtech is een scale-up in het ontwikkelen en leveren van een all-in one-oplossing voor kwalitatief en kwantitatief onderzoek. Als SaaS bedrijf zijn we volop in groei en dat voel je. Naast dat we in Nederland organisaties helpen met het doen van onderzoek, doen we dat inmiddels ook in de rest van de wereld. Ons succes? Onze missie en onze mensen. Bij Crowdtech houden we namelijk van ondernemen en vooruitgang, zonder dat we de klant uit het oog verliezen. Die staat bij ons op één. Dit doen we met een team van IT specialisten, Projectmanagers, Customer Success Managers en onze Helpdesk helden.

Neem de stap en solliciteer

Ben je enthousiast na het lezen van de vacature? Solliciteer dan direct. Eerst nog wat meer info? Neem contact op met onze Manager IT Development Ingrid Lootsma via werkenbij@crowdtech.nl of bel 020 412 0812.
